ISM-0378.description: Labels and markings indicating the owner, sensitivity, classification or any other marking that can associate media with its prior use are removed prior to its disposal.

ISM-0380.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-0380.description: Unneeded accounts, components, services and functionality of operating systems are disabled or removed.

ISM-0382.name: Application management
ISM-0382.description: Unprivileged users do not have the ability to uninstall or disable approved software.

ISM-0383.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-0383.description: Default accounts or credentials for operating systems, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-0385.name: Functional separation between servers
ISM-0385.description: Servers maintain effective functional separation with other servers allowing them to operate independently.

ISM-0393.name: Protecting database contents
ISM-0393.description: Databases and their contents are classified based on the sensitivity or classification of data that they contain.

ISM-0400.name: Development, testing and production environments
ISM-0400.description: Development, testing and production environments are segregated.

ISM-0401.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-0401.description: Secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, and secure programming practices are used as part of application development.

ISM-0402.name: Application security testing
ISM-0402.description: Applications are comprehensively tested for vulnerabilities, using static application security testing and dynamic application security testing, prior to their initial release and any subsequent releases.

ISM-0405.name: Unprivileged access to systems
ISM-0405.description: Requests for unprivileged access to systems, applications and data repositories are validated when first requested.

ISM-0407.name: Recording authorisation for personnel to access systems
ISM-0407.description:
A secure record is maintained for the life of each system covering the following for each user:
 • their user identification
 • their signed agreement to abide by usage policies for the system and its resources
 • who provided authorisation for their access
 • when their access was granted
 • the level of access that they were granted
 • when their access, and their level of access, was last reviewed
 • when their level of access was changed, and to what extent (if applicable)
 • when their access was withdrawn (if applicable).

ISM-0408.name: Logon banner
ISM-0408.description: Systems have a logon banner that reminds users of their security responsibilities when accessing the system and its resources.

ISM-0409.name: Unprivileged access to systems by foreign nationals
ISM-0409.description: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.

ISM-0411.name: Unprivileged access to systems by foreign nationals
ISM-0411.description: Foreign nationals, excluding seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AGAO data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.

ISM-0414.name: User identification
ISM-0414.description: Personnel granted access to a system and its resources are uniquely identifiable.

ISM-0415.name: User identification
ISM-0415.description: The use of shared user accounts is strictly controlled, and personnel using such accounts are uniquely identifiable.

ISM-0417.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-0417.description: When systems cannot support multi-factor authentication, single-factor authentication using passphrases is implemented instead.

ISM-0418.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-0418.description: Credentials are kept separate from systems they are used to authenticate to, except for when performing authentication activities.

ISM-0420.name: User identification
ISM-0420.description: Where a system processes, stores or communicates AUSTEO, AGAO or REL data, personnel who are foreign nationals are identified as such, including by their specific nationality.

ISM-0421.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-0421.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication are at least 4 random words with a total minimum length of 14 characters, unless more stringent requirements apply.

ISM-0422.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-0422.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication on TOP SECRET systems are at least 6 random words with a total minimum length of 20 characters.

ISM-0428.name: Session and screen locking
ISM-0428.description:
Systems are configured with a session or screen lock that:
 • activates after a maximum of 15 minutes of user inactivity, or if manually activated by users
 • conceals all session content on the screen
 • ensures that the screen does not enter a power saving state before the session or screen lock is activated
 • requires users to authenticate to unlock the session
 • denies users the ability to disable the session or screen locking mechanism.

ISM-0430.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-0430.description: Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended on the same day personnel no longer have a legitimate requirement for access.

ISM-0432.name: System access requirements
ISM-0432.description: Access requirements for a system and its resources are documented in its system security plan.

ISM-0434.name: System access requirements
ISM-0434.description: Personnel undergo appropriate employment screening and, where necessary, hold an appropriate security clearance before being granted access to a system and its resources.

ISM-0435.name: System access requirements
ISM-0435.description: Personnel receive any necessary briefings before being granted access to a system and its resources.

ISM-0441.name: Temporary access to systems
ISM-0441.description: When personnel are granted temporary access to a system, effective controls are put in place to restrict their access to only data required for them to undertake their duties.

ISM-0443.name: Temporary access to systems
ISM-0443.description: Temporary access is not granted to systems that process, store or communicate caveated or sensitive compartmented information.

ISM-0445.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-0445.description: Privileged users are assigned a dedicated privileged account to be used solely for duties requiring privileged access.

ISM-0446.name: Privileged access to systems by foreign nationals
ISM-0446.description: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have privileged access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data.

ISM-0447.name: Privileged access to systems by foreign nationals
ISM-0447.description: Foreign nationals, excluding seconded foreign nationals, do not have privileged access to systems that process, store or communicate AGAO data.

ISM-0455.name: Data recovery
ISM-0455.description: Where practical, cryptographic equipment and software provides a means of data recovery to allow for circumstances where the encryption key is unavailable due to loss, damage or failure.

ISM-0457.name: Encrypting data at rest
ISM-0457.description: Cryptographic equipment or software that has completed a Common Criteria evaluation against a Protection Profile is used when encrypting media that contains OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED data.

ISM-0459.name: Encrypting data at rest
ISM-0459.description: Full disk encryption, or partial encryption where access controls will only allow writing to the encrypted partition, is implemented when encrypting data at rest.

ISM-0460.name: Encrypting data at rest
ISM-0460.description: HACE is used when encrypting media that contains SECRET or TOP SECRET data.

ISM-0462.name: Handling encrypted IT equipment and media
ISM-0462.description: When a user authenticates to the encryption functionality of IT equipment or media, it is treated in accordance with its original sensitivity or classification until the user deauthenticates from the encryption functionality.

ISM-0465.name: Encrypting data in transit
ISM-0465.description: Cryptographic equipment or software that has completed a Common Criteria evaluation against a Protection Profile is used to protect OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED data when communicated over insufficiently secure networks, outside of appropriately secure areas or via public network infrastructure.

ISM-0467.name: Encrypting data in transit
ISM-0467.description: HACE is used to protect SECRET and TOP SECRET data when communicated over insufficiently secure networks, outside of appropriately secure areas or via public network infrastructure.

ISM-0469.name: Encrypting data in transit
ISM-0469.description: An ASD-Approved Cryptographic Protocol (AACP) or high assurance cryptographic protocol is used to protect data when communicated over network infrastructure.

ISM-0471.name: Using ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithms
ISM-0471.description: Only AACAs or high assurance cryptographic algorithms are used by cryptographic equipment and software.

ISM-0472.name: Using Diffie-Hellman
ISM-0472.description: When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus of at least 2048 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.

ISM-0474.name: Using Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman
ISM-0474.description: When using ECDH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a base point order and key size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.

ISM-0475.name: Using the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm
ISM-0475.description: When using ECDSA for digital signatures, a base point order and key size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably the P-384 curve.

ISM-0476.name: Using Rivest-Shamir-Adleman
ISM-0476.description: When using RSA for digital signatures, and passing encryption session keys or similar keys, a modulus of at least 2048 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.

ISM-0477.name: Using Rivest-Shamir-Adleman
ISM-0477.description: When using RSA for digital signatures, and for passing encryption session keys or similar keys, a different key pair is used for digital signatures and passing encrypted session keys.

ISM-0479.name: Using symmetric encryption algorithms
ISM-0479.description: Symmetric cryptographic algorithms are not used in Electronic Codebook Mode.

ISM-0481.name: Using ASD-Approved Cryptographic Protocols
ISM-0481.description: Only AACPs or high assurance cryptographic protocols are used by cryptographic equipment and software.

ISM-0484.name: Configuring Secure Shell
ISM-0484.description:
The SSH daemon is configured to:
 • only listen on the required interfaces (ListenAddress xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx)
 • have a suitable login banner (Banner x)
 • have a login authentication timeout of no more than 60 seconds (LoginGraceTime 60)
 • disable host-based authentication (HostbasedAuthentication no)
 • disable rhosts-based authentication (IgnoreRhosts yes)
 • disable the ability to login directly as root (PermitRootLogin no)
 • disable empty passwords (PermitEmptyPasswords no)
 • disable connection forwarding (AllowTCPForwarding no)
 • disable gateway ports (GatewayPorts no)
 • disable X11 forwarding (X11Forwarding no).

ISM-0485.name: Authentication mechanisms
ISM-0485.description: Public key-based authentication is used for SSH connections.

ISM-0487.name: Automated remote access
ISM-0487.description:
When using logins without a passphrase for SSH connections, the following are disabled:
 • access from IP addresses that do not require access
 • port forwarding
 • agent credential forwarding
 • X11 display remoting
 • console access.

ISM-0488.name: Automated remote access
ISM-0488.description: If using remote access without the use of a passphrase for SSH connections, the ‘forced command’ option is used to specify what command is executed and parameter checking is enabled.

ISM-0489.name: SSH-agent
ISM-0489.description: When SSH-agent or similar key caching programs are used, it is limited to workstations and servers with screen locks and key caches that are set to expire within four hours of inactivity.

ISM-0490.name: Configuring Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension
ISM-0490.description: Versions of S/MIME earlier than S/MIME version 3.0 are not used for S/MIME connections.

ISM-0494.name: Mode of operation
ISM-0494.description: Tunnel mode is used for IPsec connections; however, if using transport mode, an IP tunnel is used.

ISM-0496.name: Protocol selection
ISM-0496.description: The ESP protocol is used for authentication and encryption of IPsec connections.

ISM-0498.name: Security association lifetimes
ISM-0498.description: A security association lifetime of less than four hours (14400 seconds) is used for IPsec connections.

ISM-0499.name: Communications security doctrine
ISM-0499.description: Communications security doctrine produced by ASD for the management and operation of HACE is complied with.

ISM-0501.name: Transporting cryptographic equipment
ISM-0501.description: Keyed cryptographic equipment is transported based on the sensitivity or classification of its keying material.

ISM-0507.name: Cryptographic key management processes and procedures
ISM-0507.description: Cryptographic key management processes, and supporting cryptographic key management procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0516.name: Network documentation
ISM-0516.description: Network documentation includes high-level network diagrams showing all connections into networks and logical network diagrams showing all critical servers, high-value servers, network devices and network security appliances.

ISM-0518.name: Network documentation
ISM-0518.description: Network documentation is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0520.name: Network access controls
ISM-0520.description: Network access controls are implemented on networks to prevent the connection of unauthorised network devices and other IT equipment.

ISM-0521.name: Using Internet Protocol version 6
ISM-0521.description: IPv6 functionality is disabled in dual-stack network devices unless it is being used.

ISM-0529.name: Using Virtual Local Area Networks
ISM-0529.description: VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between networks belonging to different security domains.

ISM-0530.name: Using Virtual Local Area Networks
ISM-0530.description: Network devices managing VLANs are administered from the most trusted security domain.

ISM-0534.name: Disabling unused physical ports on network devices
ISM-0534.description: Unused physical ports on network devices are disabled.

ISM-0535.name: Using Virtual Local Area Networks
ISM-0535.description: Network devices managing VLANs belonging to different security domains do not share VLAN trunks.

ISM-0536.name: Public wireless networks
ISM-0536.description: Public wireless networks provided for general public use are segregated from all other organisation networks.

ISM-0546.name: Video-aware and voice-aware firewalls and proxies
ISM-0546.description: When video conferencing or IP telephony traffic passes through a gateway containing a firewall or proxy, a video-aware or voice-aware firewall or proxy is used.

ISM-0547.name: Protecting video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony traffic
ISM-0547.description: Video conferencing and IP telephony calls are conducted using a secure real-time transport protocol.

ISM-0548.name: Protecting video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony traffic
ISM-0548.description: Video conferencing and IP telephony calls are established using a secure session initiation protocol.

ISM-0549.name: Traffic separation
ISM-0549.description: Video conferencing and IP telephony traffic is separated physically or logically from other data traffic.

ISM-0551.name: Video conferencing unit and Internet Protocol phone authentication
ISM-0551.description:
IP telephony is configured such that:
 • IP phones authenticate themselves to the call controller upon registration
 • auto-registration is disabled and only authorised devices are allowed to access the network
 • unauthorised devices are blocked by default
 • all unused and prohibited functionality is disabled.

ISM-0553.name: Video conferencing unit and Internet Protocol phone authentication
ISM-0553.description: Authentication and authorisation is used for all actions on a video conferencing network, including call setup and changing settings.

ISM-0554.name: Video conferencing unit and Internet Protocol phone authentication
ISM-0554.description: An encrypted and non-replayable two-way authentication scheme is used for call authentication and authorisation.

ISM-0555.name: Video conferencing unit and Internet Protocol phone authentication
ISM-0555.description: Authentication and authorisation is used for all actions on an IP telephony network, including registering a new IP phone, changing phone users, changing settings and accessing voicemail.

ISM-0556.name: Traffic separation
ISM-0556.description: Workstations are not connected to video conferencing units or IP phones unless the workstation or the device uses Virtual Local Area Networks or similar mechanisms to maintain separation between video conferencing, IP telephony and other data traffic.

ISM-0558.name: Internet Protocol phones in public areas
ISM-0558.description: IP phones used in public areas do not have the ability to access data networks, voicemail and directory services.

ISM-0559.name: Microphones and webcams
ISM-0559.description: Microphones (including headsets and USB handsets) and webcams are not used with non-SECRET workstations in SECRET areas.

ISM-0565.name: Handling emails with inappropriate, invalid or missing protective markings
ISM-0565.description: Email servers are configured to block, log and report emails with inappropriate protective markings.

ISM-0567.name: Open relay email servers
ISM-0567.description: Email servers only relay emails destined for or originating from their domains (including subdomains).

ISM-0569.name: Centralised email gateways
ISM-0569.description: Emails are routed via centralised email gateways.

ISM-0570.name: Email gateway maintenance activities
ISM-0570.description: Where backup or alternative email gateways are in place, they are maintained at the same standard as the primary email gateway.

ISM-0571.name: Centralised email gateways
ISM-0571.description: When users send or receive emails, an authenticated and encrypted channel is used to route emails via their organisation’s centralised email gateways.

ISM-0572.name: Email server transport encryption
ISM-0572.description: Opportunistic TLS encryption is enabled on email servers that make incoming or outgoing email connections over public network infrastructure.

ISM-0574.name: Sender Policy Framework
ISM-0574.description: SPF is used to specify authorised email servers (or lack thereof) for an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).

ISM-0576.name: Cyber security incident management policy
ISM-0576.description: A cyber security incident management policy, and associated cyber security incident response plan, is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0580.name: Event logging policy
ISM-0580.description: An event logging policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0582.name: Operating system event logging
ISM-0582.description:
The following events are centrally logged for operating systems:
 • application and operating system crashes and error messages
 • changes to security policies and system configurations
 • successful user logons and logoffs, failed user logons and account lockouts
 • failures, restarts and changes to important processes and services
 • requests to access internet resources
 • security product-related events
 • system startups and shutdowns.

ISM-0585.name: Event log details
ISM-0585.description: For each event logged, the date and time of the event, the relevant user or process, the relevant filename, the event description, and the information technology equipment involved are recorded.

ISM-0588.name: Fax machine and multifunction device usage policy
ISM-0588.description: A fax machine and MFD usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0589.name: Scanning and copying documents on multifunction devices
ISM-0589.description: MFDs are not used to scan or copy documents above the sensitivity or classification of networks they are connected to.

ISM-0590.name: Authenticating to multifunction devices
ISM-0590.description: Authentication measures for MFDs are the same strength as those used for workstations on networks they are connected to.

ISM-0591.name: Using peripheral switches
ISM-0591.description: Evaluated peripheral switches are used when sharing peripherals between systems.

ISM-0597.name: Consultation on Cross Domain Solutions
ISM-0597.description: When planning, designing, implementing or introducing additional connectivity to CDSs, ASD is consulted and any directions provided by ASD are complied with.

ISM-0610.name: User training
ISM-0610.description: Users are trained on the secure use of CDSs before access is granted.

ISM-0611.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-0611.description: System administrators for gateways are assigned the minimum privileges required to perform their duties.

ISM-0612.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-0612.description: System administrators for gateways are formally trained on the operation and management of gateways.

ISM-0613.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-0613.description: System administrators for gateways that connect to Australian Eyes Only or Releasable To networks are Australian nationals.

ISM-0616.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-0616.description: Separation of duties is implemented in performing administrative activities for gateways.

ISM-0619.name: Authenticating to networks accessed via gateways
ISM-0619.description: Users authenticate to other networks accessed via gateways.

ISM-0622.name: Authenticating to networks accessed via gateways
ISM-0622.description: IT equipment authenticates to other networks accessed via gateways.

ISM-0626.name: Implementing Cross Domain Solutions
ISM-0626.description: CDSs are implemented between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and any other networks belonging to different security domains.

ISM-0628.name: Implementing gateways
ISM-0628.description: Gateways are implemented between networks belonging to different security domains.

ISM-0629.name: System administration of gateways
ISM-0629.description: For gateways between networks belonging to different security domains, any shared components are managed by system administrators for the higher security domain or by system administrators from a mutually agreed upon third party.

ISM-0631.name: Implementing gateways
ISM-0631.description: Gateways only allow explicitly authorised data flows.

ISM-0634.name: Gateway event logging
ISM-0634.description:
The following events are centrally logged for gateways:
 • data packets and data flows permitted through gateways
 • data packets and data flows attempting to leave gateways
 • real-time alerts for attempted intrusions.

ISM-0635.name: Separation of data flows
ISM-0635.description: CDSs implement isolated upward and downward network paths.

ISM-0637.name: Implementing gateways
ISM-0637.description: Gateways implement a demilitarised zone if external parties require access to an organisation’s services.

ISM-0639.name: Using firewalls
ISM-0639.description: Evaluated firewalls are used between networks belonging to different security domains.

ISM-0643.name: Using diodes
ISM-0643.description: Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

ISM-0645.name: Using diodes
ISM-0645.description: Evaluated diodes used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and public network infrastructure complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-0649.name: Allowing specific content types
ISM-0649.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are filtered for allowed file types.

ISM-0651.name: Performing content filtering
ISM-0651.description: Files identified by content filtering checks as malicious, or that cannot be inspected, are blocked.

ISM-0652.name: Performing content filtering
ISM-0652.description: Files identified by content filtering checks as suspicious are quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

ISM-0657.name: Manual import of data
ISM-0657.description: When manually importing data to systems, the data is scanned for malicious and active content.

ISM-0659.name: Performing content filtering
ISM-0659.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content filtering checks.

ISM-0660.name: Monitoring data import and export
ISM-0660.description: Data transfer logs for SECRET and TOP SECRET systems are fully verified at least monthly.

ISM-0661.name: User responsibilities
ISM-0661.description: Users transferring data to and from systems are held accountable for data transfers they perform.

ISM-0663.name: Data transfer processes and procedures
ISM-0663.description: Data transfer processes, and supporting data transfer procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0664.name: Authorising export of data
ISM-0664.description: Data exported from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems is reviewed and authorised by a trusted source beforehand.

ISM-0665.name: Authorising export of data
ISM-0665.description: Trusted sources for SECRET and TOP SECRET systems are limited to people and services that have been authorised as such by the Chief Information Security Officer.

ISM-0669.name: Manual export of data
ISM-0669.description: When manually exporting data from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems, digital signatures are validated and keyword checks are performed within all textual data.

ISM-0670.name: Cross Domain Solution event logging
ISM-0670.description: All security-relevant events generated by CDSs are centrally logged.

ISM-0675.name: Authorising export of data
ISM-0675.description: Data authorised for export from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems is digitally signed by a trusted source.

ISM-0677.name: Validating file integrity
ISM-0677.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs that have a digital signature or cryptographic checksum are validated.

ISM-0682.name: Using Bluetooth functionality
ISM-0682.description: Bluetooth functionality is not enabled on SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices.

ISM-0687.name: Approved mobile platforms
ISM-0687.description: Mobile devices that access SECRET or TOP SECRET systems or data use mobile platforms that have been issued an Approval for Use by ASD and are operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated Australian Communications Security Instruction.

ISM-0694.name: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers
ISM-0694.description: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers do not access SECRET and TOP SECRET systems or data.

ISM-0701.name: Mobile device emergency sanitisation processes and procedures
ISM-0701.description: Mobile device emergency sanitisation processes, and supporting mobile device emergency sanitisation procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-0702.name: Mobile device emergency sanitisation processes and procedures
ISM-0702.description: If a cryptographic zeroise or sanitise function is provided for cryptographic keys on a SECRET or TOP SECRET mobile device, the function is used as part of mobile device emergency sanitisation processes and procedures.

ISM-0705.name: Connecting mobile devices and desktop computers to the internet
ISM-0705.description: When accessing an organisation’s network via a VPN connection, split tunnelling is disabled.

ISM-0714.name: Providing cyber security leadership and guidance
ISM-0714.description: A CISO is appointed to provide cyber security leadership and guidance for their organisation (covering information technology and operational technology).

ISM-0717.name: Overseeing cyber security personnel
ISM-0717.description: The CISO oversees the management of cyber security personnel within their organisation.

ISM-0718.name: Reporting on cyber security
ISM-0718.description: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s executive committee or board of directors on cyber security matters.

ISM-0720.name: Communicating a cyber security vision and strategy
ISM-0720.description: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of a cyber security communications strategy to assist in communicating the cyber security vision and strategy for their organisation.

ISM-0724.name: Overseeing the cyber security program
ISM-0724.description: The CISO implements cyber security measurement metrics and key performance indicators for their organisation.

ISM-0725.name: Coordinating cyber security
ISM-0725.description: The CISO coordinates cyber security and business alignment through a cyber security steering committee or advisory board, comprising of key cyber security and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.

ISM-0726.name: Coordinating cyber security
ISM-0726.description: The CISO coordinates security risk management activities between cyber security and business teams.

ISM-0731.name: Working with suppliers
ISM-0731.description: The CISO oversees cyber supply chain risk management activities for their organisation.

ISM-0732.name: Receiving and managing a dedicated cyber security budget
ISM-0732.description: The CISO receives and manages a dedicated cyber security budget for their organisation.

ISM-0733.name: Overseeing cyber security incident response activities
ISM-0733.description: The CISO is fully aware of all cyber security incidents within their organisation.

ISM-0734.name: Contributing to business continuity and disaster recovery planning
ISM-0734.description: The CISO contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of business continuity and disaster recovery plans for their organisation to ensure that business-critical services are supported appropriately in the event of a disaster.

ISM-0735.name: Overseeing cyber security awareness raising
ISM-0735.description: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of their organisation’s cyber security awareness training program.

ISM-0810.name: Physical access to systems
ISM-0810.description: Systems are secured in facilities that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

ISM-0813.name: Physical access to servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment
ISM-0813.description: Server rooms, communications rooms, security containers and secure rooms are not left in unsecured states.

ISM-0817.name: Reporting suspicious contact via online services
ISM-0817.description: Personnel are advised of what suspicious contact via online services is and how to report it.

ISM-0820.name: Posting work information to online services
ISM-0820.description: Personnel are advised to not post work information to unauthorised online services and to report cases where such information is posted.

ISM-0821.name: Posting personal information to online services
ISM-0821.description: Personnel are advised of security risks associated with posting personal information to online services and are encouraged to use any available privacy settings to restrict who can view such information.

ISM-0824.name: Sending and receiving files via online services
ISM-0824.description: Personnel are advised not to send or receive files via unauthorised online services.

ISM-0829.name: Bringing radio frequency and infrared devices into facilities
ISM-0829.description: Security measures are used to detect and respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

ISM-0831.name: Handling media
ISM-0831.description: Media is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

ISM-0835.name: Treatment of volatile media following sanitisation
ISM-0835.description: Following sanitisation, TOP SECRET volatile media retains its classification if it stored static data for an extended period of time, or had data repeatedly stored on or written to the same memory location for an extended period of time.

ISM-0836.name: Non-volatile electrically erasable programmable read-only memory media sanitisation
ISM-0836.description: Non-volatile EEPROM media is sanitised by overwriting it at least once in its entirety with a random pattern followed by a read back for verification.

ISM-0839.name: Outsourcing media destruction
ISM-0839.description: The destruction of media storing accountable material is not outsourced.

ISM-0840.name: Outsourcing media destruction
ISM-0840.description: When outsourcing the destruction of media storing non-accountable material, a National Association for Information Destruction AAA certified destruction service with endorsements, as specified in ASIO’s Protective Security Circular-167, is used.

ISM-0843.name: Application control
ISM-0843.description: Application control is implemented on workstations.

ISM-0846.name: Application control
ISM-0846.description: All users (with the exception of local administrator accounts and break glass accounts) cannot disable, bypass or be exempted from application control.

ISM-0853.name: Session termination
ISM-0853.description: On a daily basis, outside of business hours and after an appropriate period of inactivity, user sessions are terminated and workstations are restarted.

ISM-0854.name: Control of Australian systems
ISM-0854.description: AUSTEO and AGAO data can only be accessed from systems under the sole control of the Australian Government that are located within facilities authorised by the Australian Government.

ISM-0859.name: Event log retention
ISM-0859.description: Event logs, excluding those for Domain Name System services and web proxies, are retained for at least seven years.

ISM-0861.name: DomainKeys Identified Mail
ISM-0861.description: DKIM signing is enabled on emails originating from an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).

ISM-0863.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-0863.description: Mobile devices prevent personnel from installing non-approved applications once provisioned.

ISM-0864.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-0864.description: Mobile devices prevent personnel from disabling or modifying security functionality once provisioned.

ISM-0866.name: Using mobile devices in public spaces
ISM-0866.description: Sensitive or classified data is not viewed or communicated in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of the screen of a mobile device being observed.

ISM-0869.name: Data storage
ISM-0869.description: Mobile devices encrypt their internal storage and any removable media.

ISM-0870.name: Maintaining control of mobile devices
ISM-0870.description: Mobile devices are carried or stored in a secured state when not being actively used.

ISM-0871.name: Maintaining control of mobile devices
ISM-0871.description: Mobile devices are kept under continual direct supervision when being actively used.

ISM-0874.name: Connecting mobile devices and desktop computers to the internet
ISM-0874.description: Mobile devices and desktop computers access the internet via a VPN connection to an organisation’s internet gateway rather than via a direct connection to the internet.

ISM-0888.name: Maintenance of security documentation
ISM-0888.description: Security documentation is reviewed at least annually and includes a ‘current as at [date]’ or equivalent statement.

ISM-0917.name: Handling and containing malicious code infections
ISM-0917.description:
When malicious code is detected, the following steps are taken to handle the infection:
 • the infected systems are isolated
 • all previously connected media used in the period leading up to the infection are scanned for signs of infection and isolated if necessary
 • antivirus software is used to remove the infection from infected systems and media
 • if the infection cannot be reliably removed, systems are restored from a known good backup or rebuilt.

ISM-0926.name: Cable colours
ISM-0926.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED cables are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

ISM-0931.name: Off-hook audio protection
ISM-0931.description: In SECRET and TOP SECRET areas, push-to-talk handsets or push-to-talk headsets are used to meet any off-hook audio protection requirements.

ISM-0938.name: User application selection
ISM-0938.description: User applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-0947.name: Using media for data transfers
ISM-0947.description: When transferring data manually between two systems belonging to different security domains, rewritable media is sanitised after each data transfer.

ISM-0955.name: Application control
ISM-0955.description: Application control is implemented using cryptographic hash rules, publisher certificate rules or path rules.

ISM-0958.name: Allowing and blocking access to domain names
ISM-0958.description: An organisation-approved list of domain names, or list of website categories, is implemented for all Hypertext Transfer Protocol and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure traffic communicated through gateways.

ISM-0961.name: Using web content filters
ISM-0961.description: Client-side active content is restricted by web content filters to an organisation-approved list of domain names.

ISM-0963.name: Using web content filters
ISM-0963.description: Web content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful web-based content.

ISM-0971.name: Secure web application design and development
ISM-0971.description: The OWASP Application Security Verification Standard is used in the development of web applications.

ISM-0974.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-0974.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate unprivileged users of systems.

ISM-0988.name: Centralised event logging facility
ISM-0988.description: An accurate time source is established and used consistently across systems to assist with identifying connections between events.

ISM-0991.name: Event log retention
ISM-0991.description: Event logs for Domain Name System services and web proxies are retained for at least 18 months.

ISM-0994.name: Asymmetric/public key algorithms
ISM-0994.description: ECDH is used in preference to DH.

ISM-0998.name: Integrity algorithms
ISM-0998.description: AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_256_128, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_384_192, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_512_256 or NONE (only with AES-GCM) is used for authenticating IPsec connections, preferably NONE.

ISM-0999.name: Diffie-Hellman groups
ISM-0999.description: DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of IPsec connections, preferably 384-bit random ECP group, 3072-bit MODP Group or 4096-bit MODP Group.

ISM-1000.name: Perfect Forward Secrecy
ISM-1000.description: PFS is used for IPsec connections.

ISM-1006.name: Network management traffic
ISM-1006.description: Security measures are implemented to prevent unauthorised access to network management traffic.

ISM-1013.name: Wireless network footprint
ISM-1013.description: The effective range of wireless communications outside an organisation’s area of control is limited by implementing RF shielding on facilities in which SECRET or TOP SECRET wireless networks are used.

ISM-1014.name: Video conferencing unit and Internet Protocol phone authentication
ISM-1014.description: Individual logins are implemented for IP phones used for SECRET or TOP SECRET conversations.

ISM-1019.name: Denial of service response plan
ISM-1019.description: A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1023.name: Handling emails with inappropriate, invalid or missing protective markings
ISM-1023.description: The intended recipients of blocked inbound emails, and the senders of blocked outbound emails, are notified.

ISM-1024.name: Notifications of undeliverable emails
ISM-1024.description: Notifications of undeliverable emails are only sent to senders that can be verified via SPF or other trusted means.

ISM-1026.name: DomainKeys Identified Mail
ISM-1026.description: DKIM signatures on incoming emails are verified.

ISM-1027.name: DomainKeys Identified Mail
ISM-1027.description: Email distribution list software used by external senders is configured such that it does not break the validity of the sender’s DKIM signature.

ISM-1028.name: Using Network-based Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems
ISM-1028.description: A NIDS or NIPS is deployed in gateways between an organisation’s networks and other networks they do not manage.

ISM-1030.name: Using Network-based Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems
ISM-1030.description: A NIDS or NIPS is located immediately inside the outermost firewall for gateways and configured to generate event logs and alerts for network traffic that contravenes any rule in a firewall ruleset.

ISM-1034.name: Host-based Intrusion Prevention System
ISM-1034.description: A HIPS is implemented on critical servers and high-value servers.

ISM-1036.name: Observing fax machine and multifunction device use
ISM-1036.description: Fax machines and MFDs are located in areas where their use can be observed.

ISM-1037.name: Assessment of gateways
ISM-1037.description: Gateways undergo testing following configuration changes, and at regular intervals no more than six months apart, to validate they conform to expected security configurations.

ISM-1053.name: Physical access to servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment
ISM-1053.description: Servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in server rooms or communications rooms that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

ISM-1055.name: Insecure authentication methods
ISM-1055.description: LAN Manager and NT LAN Manager authentication methods are disabled.

ISM-1059.name: Handling media
ISM-1059.description: All data stored on media is encrypted.

ISM-1065.name: Non-volatile magnetic media sanitisation
ISM-1065.description: The host-protected area and device configuration overlay table are reset prior to the sanitisation of non-volatile magnetic hard drives.

ISM-1067.name: Non-volatile magnetic media sanitisation
ISM-1067.description: The ATA secure erase command is used, in addition to block overwriting software, to ensure the growth defects table of non-volatile magnetic hard drives is overwritten.

ISM-1071.name: System ownership and oversight
ISM-1071.description: Each system has a designated system owner.

ISM-1073.name: Access to systems, applications and data by service providers
ISM-1073.description: An organisation’s systems, applications and data are not accessed or administered by a service provider unless a contractual arrangement exists between the organisation and the service provider to do so.

ISM-1074.name: Physical access to servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment
ISM-1074.description: Keys or equivalent access mechanisms to server rooms, communications rooms, security containers and secure rooms are appropriately controlled.

ISM-1075.name: Receiving fax messages
ISM-1075.description: The sender of a fax message makes arrangements for the receiver to collect the fax message as soon as possible after it is sent and for the receiver to notify the sender if the fax message does not arrive in an agreed amount of time.

ISM-1076.name: Sanitising televisions and computer monitors
ISM-1076.description: Televisions and computer monitors with minor burn-in or image persistence are sanitised by displaying a solid white image on the screen for an extended period of time.

ISM-1078.name: Telephone system usage policy
ISM-1078.description: A telephone system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1079.name: Maintenance and repairs of high assurance IT equipment
ISM-1079.description: ASD’s approval is sought before undertaking any maintenance or repairs to high assurance IT equipment.

ISM-1080.name: Encrypting data at rest
ISM-1080.description: An ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithm (AACA) or high assurance cryptographic algorithm is used when encrypting media.

ISM-1082.name: Mobile device usage policy
ISM-1082.description: A mobile device usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1083.name: Personnel awareness
ISM-1083.description: Personnel are advised of the sensitivity or classification permitted for voice and data communications when using mobile devices.

ISM-1084.name: Maintaining control of mobile devices
ISM-1084.description: If unable to carry or store mobile devices in a secured state, they are physically transferred in a security briefcase or an approved multi-use satchel, pouch or transit bag.

ISM-1085.name: Data communications
ISM-1085.description: Mobile devices encrypt all sensitive or classified data communicated over public network infrastructure.

ISM-1088.name: While travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1088.description:
Personnel report the potential compromise of mobile devices, removable media or credentials to their organisation as soon as possible, especially if they:
 • provide credentials to foreign government officials
 • decrypt mobile devices for foreign government officials
 • have mobile devices taken out of sight by foreign government officials
 • have mobile devices or removable media stolen, including if later returned
 • lose mobile devices or removable media, including if later found
 • observe unusual behaviour of mobile devices.

ISM-1089.name: Protective marking tools
ISM-1089.description: Protective marking tools do not allow users replying to or forwarding emails to select protective markings lower than previously used.

ISM-1091.name: Reporting cryptographic-related cyber security incidents
ISM-1091.description: Keying material is changed when compromised or suspected of being compromised.

ISM-1092.name: Sending fax messages
ISM-1092.description: Separate fax machines or MFDs are used for sending sensitive or classified fax messages and all other fax messages.

ISM-1095.name: Labelling wall outlet boxes
ISM-1095.description: Wall outlet boxes denote the systems, cable identifiers and wall outlet box identifier.

ISM-1096.name: Labelling cables
ISM-1096.description: Cables are labelled at each end with sufficient source and destination details to enable the physical identification and inspection of the cable.

ISM-1098.name: Terminating cables in cabinets
ISM-1098.description: SECRET cables are terminated in an individual cabinet; or for small systems, a cabinet with a division plate between any SECRET cables and non-SECRET cables.

ISM-1100.name: Terminating cables in cabinets
ISM-1100.description: TOP SECRET cables are terminated in an individual TOP SECRET cabinet.

ISM-1101.name: Connecting cable reticulation systems to cabinets
ISM-1101.description: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

ISM-1102.name: Connecting cable reticulation systems to cabinets
ISM-1102.description: Cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

ISM-1103.name: Connecting cable reticulation systems to cabinets
ISM-1103.description: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets not in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated at the boundary of the cabinet.

ISM-1105.name: Wall outlet boxes
ISM-1105.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes contain exclusively SECRET or TOP SECRET cables.

ISM-1107.name: Wall outlet box colours
ISM-1107.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED wall outlet boxes are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

ISM-1109.name: Wall outlet box covers
ISM-1109.description: Wall outlet box covers are clear plastic.

ISM-1111.name: Use of fibre-optic cables
ISM-1111.description: Fibre-optic cables are used for cabling infrastructure instead of copper cables.

ISM-1112.name: Cable inspectability
ISM-1112.description: Cables are inspectable at a minimum of five-metre intervals.

ISM-1114.name: Common cable reticulation systems
ISM-1114.description: Cable bundles or conduits sharing a common cable reticulation system have a dividing partition or visible gap between each cable bundle and conduit.

ISM-1115.name: Cables in walls
ISM-1115.description: Cables from cable trays to wall outlet boxes are run in flexible or plastic conduit.

ISM-1116.name: Physical separation of cabinets and patch panels
ISM-1116.description: A visible gap exists between TOP SECRET cabinets and non-TOP SECRET cabinets.

ISM-1119.name: Cable inspectability
ISM-1119.description: Cables in TOP SECRET areas are fully inspectable for their entire length.

ISM-1122.name: Wall penetrations
ISM-1122.description: Where wall penetrations exit a TOP SECRET area into a lower classified area, TOP SECRET cables are encased in conduit with all gaps between the TOP SECRET conduit and the wall filled with an appropriate sealing compound.

ISM-1123.name: Power reticulation
ISM-1123.description: A power distribution board with a feed from an Uninterruptible Power Supply is used to power all TOP SECRET IT equipment.

ISM-1130.name: Enclosed cable reticulation systems
ISM-1130.description: In shared facilities, cables are run in an enclosed cable reticulation system.

ISM-1133.name: Cables in party walls
ISM-1133.description: In shared facilities, TOP SECRET cables are not run in party walls.

ISM-1137.name: Emanation security threat assessments
ISM-1137.description: System owners deploying SECRET or TOP SECRET systems within fixed facilities contact ASD for an emanation security threat assessment.

ISM-1139.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1139.description: Only the latest version of TLS is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1143.name: Patch management processes and procedures
ISM-1143.description: Patch management processes, and supporting patch management procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1145.name: Using mobile devices in public spaces
ISM-1145.description: Privacy filters are applied to the screens of SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices.

ISM-1146.name: Posting work information to online services
ISM-1146.description: Personnel are advised to maintain separate work and personal accounts for online services.

ISM-1151.name: Sender Policy Framework
ISM-1151.description: SPF is used to verify the authenticity of incoming emails.

ISM-1157.name: Using diodes
ISM-1157.description: Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between networks.

ISM-1158.name: Using diodes
ISM-1158.description: Evaluated diodes used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and any other networks complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1160.name: Media destruction equipment
ISM-1160.description: If using degaussers to destroy media, degaussers evaluated by the United States’ National Security Agency are used.

ISM-1163.name: Continuous monitoring plan
ISM-1163.description:
Systems have a continuous monitoring plan that includes:
 • conducting vulnerability scans for systems at least fortnightly
 • conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration tests for systems prior to deployment, including prior to deployment of significant changes, and at least annually thereafter
 • analysing identified vulnerabilities to determine their potential impact
 • implementing mitigations based on risk, effectiveness and cost.

ISM-1164.name: Covers for enclosed cable reticulation systems
ISM-1164.description: In shared facilities, conduits or the front covers of ducts, cable trays in floors and ceilings, and associated fittings are clear plastic.

ISM-1171.name: Allowing and blocking access to domain names
ISM-1171.description: Attempts to access websites through their IP addresses instead of their domain names are blocked by web content filters.

ISM-1173.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1173.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate privileged users of systems.

ISM-1175.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1175.description: Privileged accounts (excluding those explicitly authorised to access online services) are prevented from accessing the internet, email and web services.

ISM-1178.name: Network documentation
ISM-1178.description: Network documentation provided to a third party, or published in public tender documentation, only contains details necessary for other parties to undertake contractual services.

ISM-1181.name: Network segmentation and segregation
ISM-1181.description: Networks are segregated into multiple network zones according to the criticality of servers, services and data.

ISM-1182.name: Network access controls
ISM-1182.description: Network access controls are implemented to limit the flow of network traffic within and between network segments to only that required for business purposes.

ISM-1183.name: Sender Policy Framework
ISM-1183.description: A hard fail SPF record is used when specifying authorised email servers (or lack thereof) for an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).

ISM-1186.name: Using Internet Protocol version 6
ISM-1186.description: IPv6 capable network security appliances are used on IPv6 and dual-stack networks.

ISM-1187.name: Manual export of data
ISM-1187.description: When manually exporting data from systems, the data is checked for unsuitable protective markings.

ISM-1192.name: Implementing gateways
ISM-1192.description: Gateways inspect and filter data flows at the transport and above network layers.

ISM-1195.name: Mobile device management policy
ISM-1195.description: Mobile Device Management solutions that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Management, version 4.0 or later, are used to enforce mobile device management policy.

ISM-1196.name: Using Bluetooth functionality
ISM-1196.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are configured to remain undiscoverable to other Bluetooth devices except during Bluetooth pairing.

ISM-1198.name: Using Bluetooth functionality
ISM-1198.description: Bluetooth pairing for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed in a manner such that connections are only made between intended Bluetooth devices.

ISM-1199.name: Using Bluetooth functionality
ISM-1199.description: Bluetooth pairings for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are removed when there is no longer a requirement for their use.

ISM-1200.name: Using Bluetooth functionality
ISM-1200.description: Bluetooth pairing for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed using Secure Connections, preferably with Numeric Comparison if supported.

ISM-1211.name: System administration processes and procedures
ISM-1211.description: System administrators document requirements for administrative activities, consider potential security impacts, obtain any necessary approvals, notify users of any disruptions or outages, and maintain system and security documentation.

ISM-1213.name: Handling and containing intrusions
ISM-1213.description: Following intrusion remediation activities, full network traffic is captured for at least seven days and analysed to determine whether malicious actors have been successfully removed from the system.

ISM-1216.name: Cable colour non-conformance
ISM-1216.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET cables with non-conformant cable colouring are banded with the appropriate colour and labelled at inspection points.

ISM-1217.name: Disposal of IT equipment
ISM-1217.description: Labels and markings indicating the owner, sensitivity, classification or any other marking that can associate IT equipment with its prior use are removed prior to its disposal.

ISM-1218.name: Sanitising highly sensitive IT equipment
ISM-1218.description: IT equipment, including associated media, that is located overseas and has processed, stored or communicated AUSTEO or AGAO data, is sanitised in situ.

ISM-1219.name: Sanitising printers and multifunction devices
ISM-1219.description: MFD print drums and image transfer rollers are inspected and destroyed if there is remnant toner which cannot be removed or a print is visible on the image transfer roller.

ISM-1220.name: Sanitising printers and multifunction devices
ISM-1220.description: Printer and MFD platens are inspected and destroyed if any text or images are retained on the platen.

ISM-1221.name: Sanitising printers and multifunction devices
ISM-1221.description: Printers and MFDs are checked to ensure no pages are trapped in the paper path due to a paper jam.

ISM-1222.name: Sanitising televisions and computer monitors
ISM-1222.description: Televisions and computer monitors that cannot be sanitised are destroyed.

ISM-1223.name: Sanitising network devices
ISM-1223.description:
Memory in network devices is sanitised using the following processes, in order of preference:
 • following device-specific guidance provided in evaluation documentation
 • following vendor sanitisation guidance
 • loading a dummy configuration file, performing a factory reset and then reinstalling firmware.

ISM-1225.name: Sanitising fax machines
ISM-1225.description: The paper tray of the fax machine is removed, and a fax message with a minimum length of four pages is transmitted, before the paper tray is re-installed to allow a fax summary page to be printed.

ISM-1226.name: Sanitising fax machines
ISM-1226.description: Fax machines are checked to ensure no pages are trapped in the paper path due to a paper jam.

ISM-1227.name: Setting credentials for user accounts
ISM-1227.description: Credentials set for user accounts are randomly generated.

ISM-1228.name: Event log monitoring
ISM-1228.description: Cyber security events are analysed in a timely manner to identify cyber security incidents.

ISM-1233.name: Key exchange
ISM-1233.description: IKE version 2 is used for key exchange when establishing IPsec connections.

ISM-1234.name: Email content filtering
ISM-1234.description: Email content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful content in email bodies and attachments.

ISM-1235.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1235.description: Add-ons, extensions and plug-ins for office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are restricted to an organisation-approved set.

ISM-1236.name: Allowing and blocking access to domain names
ISM-1236.description: Malicious domain names, dynamic domain names and domain names that can be registered anonymously for free are blocked by web content filters.

ISM-1237.name: Using web content filters
ISM-1237.description: Web content filtering is applied to outbound web traffic where appropriate.

ISM-1238.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-1238.description: Threat modelling is used in support of application development.

ISM-1239.name: Web application frameworks
ISM-1239.description: Robust web application frameworks are used in the development of web applications.

ISM-1240.name: Web application input handling
ISM-1240.description: Validation or sanitisation is performed on all input handled by web applications.

ISM-1241.name: Web application output encoding
ISM-1241.description: Output encoding is performed on all output produced by web applications.

ISM-1243.name: Database register
ISM-1243.description: A database register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1245.name: Hardening server application configurations
ISM-1245.description: All temporary installation files and logs created during server application installation processes are removed after server applications have been installed.

ISM-1246.name: Hardening server application configurations
ISM-1246.description: Server applications are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1247.name: Hardening server application configurations
ISM-1247.description: Unneeded accounts, components, services and functionality of server applications are disabled or removed.

ISM-1249.name: Restricting privileges for server applications
ISM-1249.description: Server applications are configured to run as a separate account with the minimum privileges needed to perform their functions.

ISM-1250.name: Restricting privileges for server applications
ISM-1250.description: The accounts under which server applications run have limited access to their underlying server’s file system.

ISM-1255.name: Protecting database contents
ISM-1255.description: Database users’ ability to access, insert, modify and remove database contents is restricted based on their work duties.

ISM-1256.name: Protecting databases
ISM-1256.description: File-based access controls are applied to database files.

ISM-1260.name: Hardening server application configurations
ISM-1260.description: Default accounts or credentials for server applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1263.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1263.description: Unique privileged accounts are used for administering individual server applications.

ISM-1268.name: Protecting database contents
ISM-1268.description: The need-to-know principle is enforced for database contents through the application of minimum privileges, database views and database roles.

ISM-1269.name: Functional separation between database servers and web servers
ISM-1269.description: Database servers and web servers are functionally separated.

ISM-1270.name: Network environment
ISM-1270.description: Database servers are placed on a different network segment to user workstations.

ISM-1271.name: Network environment
ISM-1271.description: Network access controls are implemented to restrict database server communications to strictly defined network resources, such as web servers, application servers and storage area networks.

ISM-1272.name: Network environment
ISM-1272.description: If only local access to a database is required, networking functionality of database management system software is disabled or directed to listen solely to the localhost interface.

ISM-1273.name: Separation of development, testing and production database servers
ISM-1273.description: Development and testing environments do not use the same database servers as production environments.

ISM-1274.name: Separation of development, testing and production databases
ISM-1274.description: Database contents from production environments are not used in development or testing environments unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.

ISM-1275.name: Web application interaction with databases
ISM-1275.description: All queries to databases from web applications are filtered for legitimate content and correct syntax.

ISM-1276.name: Web application interaction with databases
ISM-1276.description: Parameterised queries or stored procedures, instead of dynamically generated queries, are used by web applications for database interactions.

ISM-1277.name: Communications between database servers and web servers
ISM-1277.description: Data communicated between database servers and web servers is encrypted.

ISM-1278.name: Web application interaction with databases
ISM-1278.description: Web applications are designed or configured to provide as little error information as possible about the structure of databases.

ISM-1284.name: Content validation
ISM-1284.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content validation.

ISM-1286.name: Content conversion
ISM-1286.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content conversion.

ISM-1287.name: Content sanitisation
ISM-1287.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content sanitisation.

ISM-1288.name: Antivirus scanning
ISM-1288.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo antivirus scanning using multiple different scanning engines.

ISM-1289.name: Archive files
ISM-1289.description: Archive files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are unpacked in order to undergo content filtering checks.

ISM-1290.name: Archive files
ISM-1290.description: Archive files are unpacked in a controlled manner to ensure content filter performance or availability is not adversely affected.

ISM-1293.name: Encrypted files
ISM-1293.description: Encrypted files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are decrypted in order to undergo content filtering checks.

ISM-1294.name: Monitoring data import and export
ISM-1294.description: Data transfer logs for systems are partially verified at least monthly.

ISM-1296.name: Physical access to network devices in public areas
ISM-1296.description: Physical security is implemented to protect network devices in public areas from physical damage or unauthorised access.

ISM-1297.name: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers
ISM-1297.description: Legal advice is sought prior to allowing privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers to access systems or data.

ISM-1298.name: Before travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1298.description: Personnel are advised of privacy and security risks when travelling overseas with mobile devices.

ISM-1299.name: Personnel awareness
ISM-1299.description:
Personnel are advised to take the following precautions when using mobile devices:
 • never leave mobile devices or removable media unattended, including by placing them in checked-in luggage or leaving them in hotel safes
 • never store credentials with mobile devices that they grant access to, such as in laptop computer bags
 • never lend mobile devices or removable media to untrusted people, even if briefly
 • never allow untrusted people to connect their mobile devices or removable media to your mobile devices, including for charging
 • never connect mobile devices to designated charging stations or wall outlet charging ports
 • never use gifted or unauthorised peripherals, chargers or removable media with mobile devices
 • never use removable media for data transfers or backups that have not been checked for malicious code beforehand
 • avoid reuse of removable media once used with other parties’ systems or mobile devices
 • avoid connecting mobile devices to open or untrusted Wi-Fi networks
 • consider disabling any communications capabilities of mobile devices when not in use, such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Near Field Communication and ultra-wideband
 • consider periodically rebooting mobile devices
 • consider using a VPN connection to encrypt all cellular and wireless communications
 • consider using encrypted email or messaging apps for all communications.

ISM-1300.name: After travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1300.description:
Upon returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
 • sanitise and reset mobile devices, including all removable media
 • decommission any credentials that left their possession during their travel
 • report if significant doubt exists as to the integrity of any mobile devices or removable media.

ISM-1304.name: Default accounts and credentials for network devices
ISM-1304.description: Default accounts or credentials for network devices, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1311.name: Use of Simple Network Management Protocol
ISM-1311.description: SNMP version 1 and SNMP version 2 are not used on networks.

ISM-1312.name: Use of Simple Network Management Protocol
ISM-1312.description: All default SNMP community strings on network devices are changed and write access is disabled.

ISM-1314.name: Choosing wireless devices
ISM-1314.description: All wireless devices are Wi-Fi Alliance certified.

ISM-1315.name: Administrative interfaces for wireless access points
ISM-1315.description: The administrative interface on wireless access points is disabled for wireless network connections.

ISM-1316.name: Default settings
ISM-1316.description: Default SSIDs of wireless access points are changed.

ISM-1317.name: Default settings
ISM-1317.description: SSIDs of non-public wireless networks are not readily associated with an organisation, the location of their premises or the functionality of wireless networks.

ISM-1318.name: Default settings
ISM-1318.description: SSID broadcasting is not disabled on wireless access points.

ISM-1319.name: Static addressing
ISM-1319.description: Static addressing is not used for assigning IP addresses on wireless networks.

ISM-1320.name: Media Access Control address filtering
ISM-1320.description: MAC address filtering is not used to restrict which devices can connect to wireless networks.

ISM-1321.name: 802.1X authentication
ISM-1321.description: 802.1X authentication with EAP-TLS, using X.509 certificates, is used for mutual authentication; with all other EAP methods disabled on supplicants and authentication servers.

ISM-1322.name: Evaluation of 802.1X authentication implementation
ISM-1322.description: Evaluated supplicants, authenticators, wireless access points and authentication servers are used in wireless networks.

ISM-1323.name: Generating and issuing certificates for authentication
ISM-1323.description: Certificates are required for devices and users accessing wireless networks.

ISM-1324.name: Generating and issuing certificates for authentication
ISM-1324.description: Certificates are generated using an evaluated certificate authority or hardware security module.

ISM-1327.name: Generating and issuing certificates for authentication
ISM-1327.description: Certificates are protected by logical and physical access controls, encryption, and user authentication.

ISM-1330.name: Caching 802.1X authentication outcomes
ISM-1330.description: The PMK caching period is not set to greater than 1440 minutes (24 hours).

ISM-1332.name: Confidentiality and integrity of wireless network traffic
ISM-1332.description: WPA3-Enterprise 192-bit mode is used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all wireless network traffic.

ISM-1334.name: Interference between wireless networks
ISM-1334.description: Wireless networks implement sufficient frequency separation from other wireless networks.

ISM-1335.name: Protecting management frames on wireless networks
ISM-1335.description: Wireless access points enable the use of the 802.11w amendment to protect management frames.

ISM-1338.name: Wireless network footprint
ISM-1338.description: Instead of deploying a small number of wireless access points that broadcast on high power, a greater number of wireless access points that use less broadcast power are deployed to achieve the desired footprint for wireless networks.

ISM-1341.name: Host-based Intrusion Prevention System
ISM-1341.description: A HIPS is implemented on workstations.

ISM-1359.name: Removable media usage policy
ISM-1359.description: A removable media usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1361.name: Media destruction equipment
ISM-1361.description: Security Construction and Equipment Committee-approved equipment or ASIO-approved equipment is used when destroying media.

ISM-1364.name: Using Virtual Local Area Networks
ISM-1364.description: Network devices managing VLANs terminate VLANs belonging to different security domains on separate physical network interfaces.

ISM-1366.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-1366.description: Security updates are applied to mobile devices as soon as they become available.

ISM-1369.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1369.description: AES-GCM is used for encryption of TLS connections.

ISM-1370.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1370.description: Only server-initiated secure renegotiation is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1372.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1372.description: DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of TLS connections.

ISM-1373.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1373.description: Anonymous DH is not used for TLS connections.

ISM-1374.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1374.description: SHA-2-based certificates are used for TLS connections.

ISM-1375.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1375.description: SHA-2 is used for the Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) and pseudorandom function (PRF) for TLS connections.

ISM-1380.name: Separate privileged operating environments
ISM-1380.description: Privileged users use separate privileged and unprivileged operating environments.

ISM-1385.name: Administrative infrastructure
ISM-1385.description: Administrative infrastructure is segregated from the wider network and the internet.

ISM-1386.name: Administrative infrastructure
ISM-1386.description: Network management traffic can only originate from administrative infrastructure.

ISM-1387.name: Administrative infrastructure
ISM-1387.description: Administrative activities are conducted through jump servers.

ISM-1389.name: Automated dynamic analysis
ISM-1389.description: Executable files imported via gateways or CDSs are automatically executed in a sandbox to detect any suspicious behaviour.

ISM-1392.name: Application control
ISM-1392.description: When implementing application control using path rules, only approved users can modify approved files and write to approved folders.

ISM-1395.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1395.description: Service providers, including any subcontractors, provide an appropriate level of protection for any data entrusted to them or their services.

ISM-1400.name: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers
ISM-1400.description: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers have enforced separation of work data from personal data.

ISM-1401.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1401.description: Multi-factor authentication uses either: something users have and something users know, or something users have that is unlocked by something users know or are.

ISM-1402.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1402.description: Credentials stored on systems are protected by a password manager; a hardware security module; or by salting, hashing and stretching them before storage within a database.

ISM-1403.name: Account lockouts
ISM-1403.description: Accounts, except for break glass accounts, are locked out after a maximum of five failed logon attempts.

ISM-1404.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-1404.description: Unprivileged access to systems and applications is disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

ISM-1405.name: Centralised event logging facility
ISM-1405.description: A centralised event logging facility is implemented and event logs are sent to the facility as soon as possible after they occur.

ISM-1406.name: Standard Operating Environments
ISM-1406.description: SOEs are used for workstations and servers.

ISM-1407.name: Operating system releases and versions
ISM-1407.description: The latest release, or the previous release, of operating systems are used.

ISM-1408.name: Operating system releases and versions
ISM-1408.description: Where supported, 64-bit versions of operating systems are used.

ISM-1409.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1409.description: Operating systems are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1412.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1412.description: Web browsers are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1416.name: Software firewall
ISM-1416.description: A software firewall is implemented on workstations and servers to restrict inbound and outbound network connections to an organisation-approved set of applications and services.

ISM-1417.name: Antivirus software
ISM-1417.description:
Antivirus software is implemented on workstations and servers with:
 • signature-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
 • heuristic-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
 • reputation rating functionality enabled
 • ransomware protection functionality enabled
 • detection signatures configured to update on at least a daily basis
 • regular scanning configured for all fixed disks and removable media.

ISM-1418.name: Device access control software
ISM-1418.description: If there is no business requirement for reading from removable media and devices, such functionality is disabled via the use of device access control software or by disabling external communication interfaces.

ISM-1419.name: Development, testing and production environments
ISM-1419.description: Development and modification of software only takes place in development environments.

ISM-1420.name: Development, testing and production environments
ISM-1420.description: Data from production environments is not used in a development or testing environment unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.

ISM-1422.name: Development, testing and production environments
ISM-1422.description: Unauthorised access to the authoritative source for software is prevented.

ISM-1424.name: Web browser-based controls
ISM-1424.description: Web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options via security policy in response headers.

ISM-1427.name: Implementing gateways
ISM-1427.description: Gateways perform ingress traffic filtering to detect and prevent IP source address spoofing.

ISM-1428.name: Using Internet Protocol version 6
ISM-1428.description: Unless explicitly required, IPv6 tunnelling is disabled on all network devices.

ISM-1429.name: Using Internet Protocol version 6
ISM-1429.description: IPv6 tunnelling is blocked by network security appliances at externally-connected network boundaries.

ISM-1430.name: Using Internet Protocol version 6
ISM-1430.description: Dynamically assigned IPv6 addresses are configured with Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol version 6 in a stateful manner with lease data stored in a centralised event logging facility.

ISM-1431.name: Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies
ISM-1431.description:
Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies are discussed with cloud service providers, specifically:
 • their capacity to withstand denial-of-service attacks
 • costs likely to be incurred as a result of denial-of-service attacks
 • availability monitoring and thresholds for notification of denial-of-service attacks
 • thresholds for turning off any online services or functionality during denial-of-service attacks
 • pre-approved actions that can be undertaken during denial-of-service attacks
 • any arrangements with upstream service providers to block malicious network traffic as far upstream as possible.
