ISM-1432.name: Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies
ISM-1432.description: Domain names for online services are protected via registrar locking and confirming that domain registration details are correct.

ISM-1436.name: Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies
ISM-1436.description: Critical online services are segregated from other online services that are more likely to be targeted as part of denial-of-service attacks.

ISM-1437.name: Cloud-based hosting of online services
ISM-1437.description: Cloud service providers are used for hosting online services.

ISM-1438.name: Using content delivery networks
ISM-1438.description: Where a high availability requirement exists for website hosting, CDNs that cache websites are used.

ISM-1439.name: Using content delivery networks
ISM-1439.description: If using CDNs, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the CDNs and authorised management networks.

ISM-1446.name: Using Elliptic Curve Cryptography
ISM-1446.description: When using elliptic curve cryptography, a suitable curve from NIST SP 800-186 is used.

ISM-1448.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1448.description: When using DH or ECDH for key establishment of TLS connections, the ephemeral variant is used.

ISM-1449.name: Authentication mechanisms
ISM-1449.description: SSH private keys are protected with a passphrase or a key encryption key.

ISM-1450.name: Microphones and webcams
ISM-1450.description: Microphones (including headsets and USB handsets) and webcams are not used with non-TOP SECRET workstations in TOP SECRET areas.

ISM-1451.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1451.description: Types of data and its ownership is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1452.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1452.description: A supply chain risk assessment is performed for suppliers of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services in order to assess the impact to a system’s security risk profile.

ISM-1453.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1453.description: Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1454.name: Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service authentication
ISM-1454.description: Communications between authenticators and a RADIUS server are encapsulated with an additional layer of encryption using RADIUS over Internet Protocol Security or RADIUS over Transport Layer Security.

ISM-1457.name: Using peripheral switches
ISM-1457.description: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET and TOP SECRET systems, or between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems belonging to different security domains, preferably complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1460.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1460.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism is from a vendor that has demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1461.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1461.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware for SECRET or TOP SECRET computing environments, the physical server and all computing environments are of the same classification and belong to the same security domain.

ISM-1467.name: User application releases
ISM-1467.description: The latest release of office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are used.

ISM-1470.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1470.description: Unneeded components, services and functionality of office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are disabled or removed.

ISM-1471.name: Application control
ISM-1471.description: When implementing application control using publisher certificate rules, publisher names and product names are used.

ISM-1478.name: Overseeing the cyber security program
ISM-1478.description: The CISO oversees their organisation’s cyber security program and ensures their organisation’s compliance with cyber security policy, standards, regulations and legislation.

ISM-1479.name: Functional separation between servers
ISM-1479.description: Servers minimise communications with other servers at the network and file system level.

ISM-1480.name: Using peripheral switches
ISM-1480.description: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems and any non-SECRET or TOP SECRET systems complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1482.name: Organisation-owned mobile devices and desktop computers
ISM-1482.description: Personnel accessing systems or data using an organisation-owned mobile device or desktop computer are either prohibited from using it for personal purposes or have enforced separation of work data from any personal data.

ISM-1483.name: Server application releases
ISM-1483.description: The latest release of internet-facing server applications are used.

ISM-1485.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1485.description: Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.

ISM-1486.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1486.description: Web browsers do not process Java from the internet.

ISM-1487.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1487.description: Only privileged users responsible for checking that Microsoft Office macros are free of malicious code can write to and modify content within Trusted Locations.

ISM-1488.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1488.description: Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

ISM-1489.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1489.description: Microsoft Office macro security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1490.name: Application control
ISM-1490.description: Application control is implemented on internet-facing servers.

ISM-1491.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1491.description:
Unprivileged users are prevented from running script execution engines, including:
 • Windows Script Host (cscript.exe and wscript.exe)
 • PowerShell (powershell.exe, powershell_ise.exe and pwsh.exe)
 • Command Prompt (cmd.exe)
 • Windows Management Instrumentation (wmic.exe)
 • Microsoft Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) Application Host (mshta.exe).

ISM-1492.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1492.description: Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.

ISM-1493.name: Software register
ISM-1493.description: Software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other IT equipment are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1501.name: Cessation of support
ISM-1501.description: Operating systems that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.

ISM-1502.name: Blocking suspicious emails
ISM-1502.description: Emails arriving via an external connection where the email source address uses an internal domain, or internal subdomain, are blocked at the email gateway.

ISM-1504.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1504.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to their organisation’s online services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive data.

ISM-1505.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1505.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users of data repositories.

ISM-1506.name: Configuring Secure Shell
ISM-1506.description: The use of SSH version 1 is disabled for SSH connections.

ISM-1507.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1507.description: Requests for privileged access to systems, applications and data repositories are validated when first requested.

ISM-1508.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1508.description: Privileged access to systems, applications and data repositories is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1509.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1509.description: Privileged access events are centrally logged.

ISM-1510.name: Digital preservation policy
ISM-1510.description: A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1511.name: Performing and retaining backups
ISM-1511.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are performed and retained in accordance with business criticality and business continuity requirements.

ISM-1515.name: Testing restoration of backups
ISM-1515.description: Restoration of data, applications and settings from backups to a common point in time is tested as part of disaster recovery exercises.

ISM-1517.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1517.description: Equipment that is capable of reducing microform to a fine powder, with resultant particles not showing more than five consecutive characters per particle upon microscopic inspection, is used to destroy microfiche and microfilm.

ISM-1520.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-1520.description: System administrators for gateways undergo appropriate employment screening, and where necessary hold an appropriate security clearance, based on the sensitivity or classification of gateways.

ISM-1521.name: Separation of data flows
ISM-1521.description: CDSs implement protocol breaks at each network layer.

ISM-1522.name: Separation of data flows
ISM-1522.description: CDSs implement independent security-enforcing functions for upward and downward network paths.

ISM-1523.name: Cross Domain Solution event logging
ISM-1523.description: A sample of security-relevant events relating to data transfer policies are taken at least every three months and assessed against security policies for CDSs to identify any operational failures.

ISM-1524.name: Performing content filtering
ISM-1524.description: Content filters used by CDSs undergo rigorous security testing to ensure they perform as expected and cannot be bypassed.

ISM-1525.name: System ownership and oversight
ISM-1525.description: System owners register each system with its authorising officer.

ISM-1526.name: Protecting systems and their resources
ISM-1526.description: System owners monitor each system, and associated cyber threats, security risks and controls, on an ongoing basis.

ISM-1528.name: Using firewalls
ISM-1528.description: Evaluated firewalls are used between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

ISM-1529.name: Outsourced cloud services
ISM-1529.description: Only community or private clouds are used for outsourced SECRET and TOP SECRET cloud services.

ISM-1530.name: Physical access to servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment
ISM-1530.description: Servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in security containers or secure rooms suitable for their classification taking into account the combination of security zones they reside in.

ISM-1532.name: Using Virtual Local Area Networks
ISM-1532.description: VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

ISM-1533.name: Mobile device management policy
ISM-1533.description: A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1534.name: Sanitising printers and multifunction devices
ISM-1534.description: Printer ribbons in printers and MFDs are removed and destroyed.

ISM-1535.name: Data transfer processes and procedures
ISM-1535.description: Processes, and supporting procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained to prevent AUSTEO, AGAO and REL data in textual and non-textual formats from being exported to unsuitable foreign systems.

ISM-1536.name: Web application interaction with databases
ISM-1536.description: All queries to databases from web applications that are initiated by users, and any resulting crash or error messages, are centrally logged.

ISM-1537.name: Database event logging
ISM-1537.description:
The following events are centrally logged for databases:
 • access or modification of particularly important content
 • addition of new users, especially privileged users
 • changes to user roles or privileges
 • attempts to elevate user privileges
 • queries containing comments
 • queries containing multiple embedded queries
 • database and query alerts or failures
 • database structure changes
 • database administrator actions
 • use of executable commands
 • database logons and logoffs.

ISM-1540.name: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance
ISM-1540.description: DMARC records are configured for an organisation’s domains (including subdomains) such that emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

ISM-1542.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1542.description: Microsoft Office is configured to prevent activation of Object Linking and Embedding packages.

ISM-1543.name: Bringing radio frequency and infrared devices into facilities
ISM-1543.description: An authorised RF and IR device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1544.name: Application control
ISM-1544.description: Microsoft’s recommended application blocklist is implemented.

ISM-1546.name: Authenticating to systems
ISM-1546.description: Users are authenticated before they are granted access to a system and its resources.

ISM-1547.name: Data backup and restoration processes and procedures
ISM-1547.description: Data backup processes, and supporting data backup procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1548.name: Data backup and restoration processes and procedures
ISM-1548.description: Data restoration processes, and supporting data restoration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1549.name: Media management policy
ISM-1549.description: A media management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1550.name: IT equipment disposal processes and procedures
ISM-1550.description: IT equipment disposal processes, and supporting IT equipment disposal procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1551.name: IT equipment management policy
ISM-1551.description: An IT equipment management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1552.name: Web application interactions
ISM-1552.description: All web application content is offered exclusively using HTTPS.

ISM-1553.name: Configuring Transport Layer Security
ISM-1553.description: TLS compression is disabled for TLS connections.

ISM-1554.name: Before travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1554.description:
If travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel are:
 • issued with newly provisioned accounts, mobile devices and removable media from a pool of dedicated travel devices which are used solely for work-related activities
 • advised on how to apply and inspect tamper seals to key areas of mobile devices
 • advised to avoid taking any personal mobile devices, especially if rooted or jailbroken.

ISM-1555.name: Before travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1555.description:
Before travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
 • record all details of the mobile devices being taken, such as product types, serial numbers and International Mobile Equipment Identity numbers
 • update all operating systems and applications
 • remove all non-essential data, applications and accounts
 • backup all remaining data, applications and settings.

ISM-1556.name: After travelling overseas with mobile devices
ISM-1556.description:
If returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel take the following additional actions:
 • reset credentials used with mobile devices, including those used for remote access to their organisation’s systems
 • monitor accounts for any indicators of compromise, such as failed logon attempts.

ISM-1557.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-1557.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication on SECRET systems are at least 5 random words with a total minimum length of 17 characters.

ISM-1558.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-1558.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication are not a list of categorised words; do not form a real sentence in a natural language; and are not constructed from song lyrics, movies, literature or any other publicly available material.

ISM-1559.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1559.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication are a minimum of 6 characters, unless more stringent requirements apply.

ISM-1560.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1560.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication on SECRET systems are a minimum of 8 characters.

ISM-1561.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1561.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication on TOP SECRET systems are a minimum of 10 characters.

ISM-1562.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony infrastructure hardening
ISM-1562.description: Video conferencing and IP telephony infrastructure is hardened.

ISM-1563.name: Security assessment report
ISM-1563.description:
At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
 • the scope of the security assessment
 • the system’s strengths and weaknesses
 • security risks associated with the operation of the system
 • the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
 • any recommended remediation actions.

ISM-1564.name: Plan of action and milestones
ISM-1564.description: At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

ISM-1565.name: Providing cyber security awareness training
ISM-1565.description: Tailored privileged user training is undertaken annually by all privileged users.

ISM-1566.name: Unprivileged access to systems
ISM-1566.description: Use of unprivileged access is centrally logged.

ISM-1567.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1567.description: Suppliers identified as high risk by a cyber supply chain risk assessment are not used.

ISM-1568.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1568.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to the security of their products and services.

ISM-1569.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1569.description: A shared responsibility model is created, documented and shared between suppliers and their customers in order to articulate the security responsibilities of each party.

ISM-1570.name: Assessment of outsourced cloud service providers
ISM-1570.description: Outsourced cloud service providers and their cloud services undergo a security assessment by an IRAP assessor at least every 24 months.

ISM-1571.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1571.description: The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1572.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1572.description: The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated, as well as a minimum notification period for any configuration changes, is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1573.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1573.description: Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1574.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1574.description: The storage of data in a portable manner that allows for backups, service migration and service decommissioning without any loss of data is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1575.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1575.description: A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1576.name: Access to systems, applications and data by service providers
ISM-1576.description: If an organisation’s systems, applications or data are accessed or administered by a service provider in an unauthorised manner, the organisation is immediately notified.

ISM-1577.name: Network segmentation and segregation
ISM-1577.description: An organisation’s networks are segregated from their service providers’ networks.

ISM-1579.name: Capacity and availability planning and monitoring for online services
ISM-1579.description: Cloud service providers’ ability to dynamically scale resources in response to a genuine spike in demand is discussed and verified as part of capacity and availability planning for online services.

ISM-1580.name: Capacity and availability planning and monitoring for online services
ISM-1580.description: Where a high availability requirement exists for online services, the services are architected to automatically transition between availability zones.

ISM-1581.name: Capacity and availability planning and monitoring for online services
ISM-1581.description: Continuous real-time monitoring of the capacity and availability of online services is performed.

ISM-1582.name: Application control
ISM-1582.description: Application control rulesets are validated on an annual or more frequent basis.

ISM-1583.name: User identification
ISM-1583.description: Personnel who are contractors are identified as such.

ISM-1584.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1584.description: Unprivileged users are prevented from bypassing, disabling or modifying security functionality of operating systems.

ISM-1585.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1585.description: Web browser security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1586.name: Monitoring data import and export
ISM-1586.description: Data transfer logs are used to record all data imports and exports from systems.

ISM-1587.name: Annual reporting of system security status
ISM-1587.description: System owners report the security status of each system to its authorising officer at least annually.

ISM-1588.name: Standard Operating Environments
ISM-1588.description: SOEs are reviewed and updated at least annually.

ISM-1589.name: Email server transport encryption
ISM-1589.description: MTA-STS is enabled to prevent the unencrypted transfer of emails between email servers.

ISM-1590.name: Changing credentials
ISM-1590.description:
Credentials are changed if:
 • they are compromised
 • they are suspected of being compromised
 • they are discovered stored on networks in the clear
 • they are discovered being transferred across networks in the clear
 • membership of a shared account changes
 • they have not been changed in the past 12 months.

ISM-1591.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-1591.description: Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

ISM-1592.name: Application management
ISM-1592.description: Unprivileged users do not have the ability to install unapproved software.

ISM-1593.name: Setting credentials for user accounts
ISM-1593.description: Users provide sufficient evidence to verify their identity when requesting new credentials.

ISM-1594.name: Setting credentials for user accounts
ISM-1594.description: Credentials are provided to users via a secure communications channel or, if not possible, split into two parts with one part provided to users and the other part provided to supervisors.

ISM-1595.name: Setting credentials for user accounts
ISM-1595.description: Credentials provided to users are changed on first use.

ISM-1596.name: Setting credentials for user accounts
ISM-1596.description: Credentials, in the form of memorised secrets, are not reused by users across different systems.

ISM-1597.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1597.description: Credentials are obscured as they are entered into systems.

ISM-1598.name: Inspection of IT equipment following maintenance and repairs
ISM-1598.description: Following maintenance or repair activities for IT equipment, the IT equipment is inspected to confirm it retains its approved software configuration and that no unauthorised modifications have taken place.

ISM-1599.name: Handling IT equipment
ISM-1599.description: IT equipment is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

ISM-1600.name: Sanitising media before first use
ISM-1600.description: Media is sanitised before it is used for the first time.

ISM-1601.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1601.description: Microsoft’s attack surface reduction rules are implemented.

ISM-1602.name: Communication of security documentation
ISM-1602.description: Security documentation, including notification of subsequent changes, is communicated to all stakeholders.

ISM-1603.name: Insecure authentication methods
ISM-1603.description: Authentication methods susceptible to replay attacks are disabled.

ISM-1604.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1604.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the configuration of the isolation mechanism is hardened by removing unneeded functionality and restricting access to the administrative interface used to manage the isolation mechanism.

ISM-1605.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1605.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the underlying operating system is hardened.

ISM-1606.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1606.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, patches, updates or vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities are applied to the isolation mechanism and underlying operating system in a timely manner.

ISM-1607.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1607.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, integrity and log monitoring are performed for the isolation mechanism and underlying operating system in a timely manner.

ISM-1608.name: Standard Operating Environments
ISM-1608.description: SOEs provided by third parties are scanned for malicious code and configurations.

ISM-1609.name: Handling and containing intrusions
ISM-1609.description: System owners are consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.

ISM-1610.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1610.description: A method of emergency access to systems is documented and tested at least once when initially implemented and each time fundamental information technology infrastructure changes occur.

ISM-1611.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1611.description: Break glass accounts are only used when normal authentication processes cannot be used.

ISM-1612.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1612.description: Break glass accounts are only used for specific authorised activities.

ISM-1613.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1613.description: Use of break glass accounts is centrally logged.

ISM-1614.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1614.description: Break glass account credentials are changed by the account custodian after they are accessed by any other party.

ISM-1615.name: Emergency access to systems
ISM-1615.description: Break glass accounts are tested after credentials are changed.

ISM-1616.name: Vulnerability disclosure program
ISM-1616.description: A vulnerability disclosure program is implemented to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services.

ISM-1617.name: Overseeing the cyber security program
ISM-1617.description: The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.

ISM-1618.name: Overseeing cyber security incident response activities
ISM-1618.description: The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.

ISM-1619.name: Setting credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts
ISM-1619.description: Service accounts are created as group Managed Service Accounts.

ISM-1620.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services security group memberships
ISM-1620.description: Privileged user accounts are members of the Protected Users security group.

ISM-1621.name: PowerShell
ISM-1621.description: Windows PowerShell 2.0 is disabled or removed.

ISM-1622.name: PowerShell
ISM-1622.description: PowerShell is configured to use Constrained Language Mode.

ISM-1623.name: PowerShell
ISM-1623.description: PowerShell module logging, script block logging and transcription events are centrally logged.

ISM-1624.name: PowerShell
ISM-1624.description: PowerShell script block logs are protected by Protected Event Logging functionality.

ISM-1625.name: Insider threat mitigation program
ISM-1625.description: An insider threat mitigation program is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1626.name: Insider threat mitigation program
ISM-1626.description: Legal advice is sought regarding the development and implementation of an insider threat mitigation program.

ISM-1627.name: Blocking anonymity network traffic
ISM-1627.description: Inbound network connections from anonymity networks are blocked.

ISM-1628.name: Blocking anonymity network traffic
ISM-1628.description: Outbound network connections to anonymity networks are blocked.

ISM-1629.name: Using Diffie-Hellman
ISM-1629.description: When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus and associated parameters are selected according to NIST SP 800-56A Rev. 3.

ISM-1631.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1631.description: Suppliers of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services associated with systems are identified.

ISM-1632.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1632.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have a strong track record of maintaining the security of their own systems and cyber supply chains.

ISM-1633.name: Protecting systems and their resources
ISM-1633.description: System owners determine the type, value and security objectives for each system based on an assessment of the impact if it were to be compromised.

ISM-1634.name: Protecting systems and their resources
ISM-1634.description: System owners select controls for each system and tailor them to achieve desired security objectives.

ISM-1635.name: Protecting systems and their resources
ISM-1635.description: System owners implement controls for each system and its operating environment.

ISM-1636.name: Protecting systems and their resources
ISM-1636.description: System owners ensure controls for each system and its operating environment are assessed to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

ISM-1637.name: Outsourced cloud services
ISM-1637.description: An outsourced cloud service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1638.name: Outsourced cloud services
ISM-1638.description:
An outsourced cloud service register contains the following for each outsourced cloud service:
 • cloud service provider’s name
 • cloud service’s name
 • purpose for using the cloud service
 • sensitivity or classification of data involved
 • due date for the next security assessment of the cloud service
 • contractual arrangements for the cloud service
 • point of contact for users of the cloud service
 • 24/7 contact details for the cloud service provider.

ISM-1639.name: Labelling building management cables
ISM-1639.description: Building management cables are labelled with their purpose in black writing on a yellow background, with a minimum size of 2.5 cm x 1 cm, and attached at five-metre intervals.

ISM-1640.name: Labelling cables for foreign systems in Australian facilities
ISM-1640.description: Cables for foreign systems installed in Australian facilities are labelled at inspection points.

ISM-1641.name: Degaussing magnetic media
ISM-1641.description: Following the use of a degausser, magnetic media is physically damaged by deforming any internal platters.

ISM-1642.name: Sanitising media before first use
ISM-1642.description: Media is sanitised before it is reused in a different security domain.

ISM-1643.name: Software register
ISM-1643.description: Software registers contain versions and patch histories of applications, drivers, operating systems and firmware.

ISM-1644.name: Using mobile devices in public spaces
ISM-1644.description: Sensitive or classified phone calls are not conducted in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of conversations being overheard.

ISM-1645.name: Floor plan diagrams
ISM-1645.description: Floor plan diagrams are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1646.name: Floor plan diagrams
ISM-1646.description:
Floor plan diagrams contain the following:
 • cable paths (including ingress and egress points between floors)
 • cable reticulation system and conduit paths
 • floor concentration boxes
 • wall outlet boxes
 • network cabinets.

ISM-1647.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-1647.description: Privileged access to systems, applications and data repositories is disabled after 12 months unless revalidated.

ISM-1648.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-1648.description: Privileged access to systems and applications is disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

ISM-1649.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1649.description: Just-in-time administration is used for administering systems and applications.

ISM-1650.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1650.description: Privileged account and group management events are centrally logged.

ISM-1654.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1654.description: Internet Explorer 11 is disabled or removed.

ISM-1655.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1655.description: .NET Framework 3.5 (includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0) is disabled or removed.

ISM-1656.name: Application control
ISM-1656.description: Application control is implemented on non-internet-facing servers.

ISM-1657.name: Application control
ISM-1657.description: Application control restricts the execution of executables, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML applications and control panel applets to an organisation-approved set.

ISM-1658.name: Application control
ISM-1658.description: Application control restricts the execution of drivers to an organisation-approved set.

ISM-1659.name: Application control
ISM-1659.description: Microsoft’s vulnerable driver blocklist is implemented.

ISM-1660.name: Application control
ISM-1660.description: Allowed and blocked application control events are centrally logged.

ISM-1667.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1667.description: Microsoft Office is blocked from creating child processes.

ISM-1668.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1668.description: Microsoft Office is blocked from creating executable content.

ISM-1669.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1669.description: Microsoft Office is blocked from injecting code into other processes.

ISM-1670.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1670.description: PDF software is blocked from creating child processes.

ISM-1671.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1671.description: Microsoft Office macros are disabled for users that do not have a demonstrated business requirement.

ISM-1672.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1672.description: Microsoft Office macro antivirus scanning is enabled.

ISM-1673.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1673.description: Microsoft Office macros are blocked from making Win32 API calls.

ISM-1674.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1674.description: Only Microsoft Office macros running from within a sandboxed environment, a Trusted Location or that are digitally signed by a trusted publisher are allowed to execute.

ISM-1675.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1675.description: Microsoft Office macros digitally signed by an untrusted publisher cannot be enabled via the Message Bar or Backstage View.

ISM-1676.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1676.description: Microsoft Office’s list of trusted publishers is validated on an annual or more frequent basis.

ISM-1677.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1677.description: Allowed and blocked Microsoft Office macro execution events are centrally logged.

ISM-1679.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1679.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to third-party online services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive data.

ISM-1680.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1680.description: Multi-factor authentication (where available) is used to authenticate users to third-party online services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s non-sensitive data.

ISM-1681.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1681.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate customers to online customer services that process, store or communicate sensitive customer data.

ISM-1682.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1682.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating users of systems is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1683.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1683.description: Successful and unsuccessful multi-factor authentication events are centrally logged.

ISM-1685.name: Setting credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts
ISM-1685.description: Credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts are long, unique, unpredictable and managed.

ISM-1687.name: Separate privileged operating environments
ISM-1687.description: Privileged operating environments are not virtualised within unprivileged operating environments.

ISM-1688.name: Separate privileged operating environments
ISM-1688.description: Unprivileged accounts cannot logon to privileged operating environments.

ISM-1689.name: Separate privileged operating environments
ISM-1689.description: Privileged accounts (excluding local administrator accounts) cannot logon to unprivileged operating environments.

ISM-1690.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1690.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in online services are applied within two weeks of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1691.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1691.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within two weeks of release.

ISM-1692.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1692.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1693.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1693.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in applications other than office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within one month of release.

ISM-1694.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1694.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing servers and internet-facing network devices are applied within two weeks of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1695.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1695.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, non-internet-facing servers and non-internet-facing network devices are applied within one month of release.

ISM-1696.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1696.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, non-internet-facing servers and non-internet-facing network devices are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1697.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1697.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in drivers are applied within one month of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1698.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1698.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least daily to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in online services.

ISM-1699.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1699.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least weekly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products.

ISM-1700.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1700.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in applications other than office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products.

ISM-1701.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1701.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least daily to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing servers and internet-facing network devices.

ISM-1702.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1702.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, non-internet-facing servers and non-internet-facing network devices.

ISM-1703.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1703.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in drivers.

ISM-1704.name: Cessation of support
ISM-1704.description: Office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, Adobe Flash Player, and security products that are no longer supported by vendors are removed.

ISM-1705.name: Backup access
ISM-1705.description: Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) cannot access backups belonging to other accounts.

ISM-1706.name: Backup access
ISM-1706.description: Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) cannot access their own backups.

ISM-1707.name: Backup modification and deletion
ISM-1707.description: Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) are prevented from modifying and deleting backups.

ISM-1708.name: Backup modification and deletion
ISM-1708.description: Backup administrator accounts are prevented from modifying and deleting backups during their retention period.

ISM-1710.name: Default settings
ISM-1710.description: Settings for wireless access points are hardened.

ISM-1711.name: 802.1X authentication
ISM-1711.description: User identity confidentiality is used if available with EAP-TLS implementations.

ISM-1712.name: Fast Basic Service Set Transition
ISM-1712.description: The use of FT (802.11r) is disabled unless authenticator-to-authenticator communications are secured by an ASD-Approved Cryptographic Protocol.

ISM-1713.name: Removable media register
ISM-1713.description: A removable media register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1716.name: Suspension of access to systems
ISM-1716.description: Access to data repositories is disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

ISM-1717.name: Vulnerability disclosure program
ISM-1717.description: A ‘security.txt’ file is hosted for all internet-facing organisational domains to assist in the responsible disclosure of vulnerabilities in an organisation’s products and services.

ISM-1718.name: Cable colours
ISM-1718.description: SECRET cables are coloured salmon pink.

ISM-1719.name: Cable colours
ISM-1719.description: TOP SECRET cables are coloured red.

ISM-1720.name: Wall outlet box colours
ISM-1720.description: SECRET wall outlet boxes are coloured salmon pink.

ISM-1721.name: Wall outlet box colours
ISM-1721.description: TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes are coloured red.

ISM-1722.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1722.description: Electrostatic memory devices are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator or grinder/sander.

ISM-1723.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1723.description: Magnetic floppy disks are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, degausser or by cutting.

ISM-1724.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1724.description: Magnetic hard disks are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, grinder/sander or degausser.

ISM-1725.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1725.description: Magnetic tapes are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, degausser or by cutting.

ISM-1726.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1726.description: Optical disks are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, grinder/sander or by cutting.

ISM-1727.name: Media destruction methods
ISM-1727.description: Semiconductor memory is destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill or disintegrator.

ISM-1728.name: Treatment of media waste particles
ISM-1728.description: The resulting media waste particles from the destruction of SECRET media is stored and handled as OFFICIAL if less than or equal to 3 mm, PROTECTED if greater than 3 mm and less than or equal to 6 mm, or SECRET if greater than 6 mm and less than or equal to 9 mm.

ISM-1729.name: Treatment of media waste particles
ISM-1729.description: The resulting media waste particles from the destruction of TOP SECRET media is stored and handled as OFFICIAL if less than or equal to 3 mm, or SECRET if greater than 3 mm and less than or equal to 9 mm.

ISM-1730.name: Software bill of materials
ISM-1730.description: A software bill of materials is produced and made available to consumers of software.

ISM-1731.name: Handling and containing intrusions
ISM-1731.description: Planning and coordination of intrusion remediation activities are conducted on a separate system to that which has been compromised.

ISM-1732.name: Handling and containing intrusions
ISM-1732.description: To the extent possible, all intrusion remediation activities are conducted in a coordinated manner during the same planned outage.

ISM-1735.name: Media that cannot be successfully sanitised
ISM-1735.description: Faulty or damaged media that cannot be successfully sanitised is destroyed prior to its disposal.

ISM-1736.name: Managed services
ISM-1736.description: A managed service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1737.name: Managed services
ISM-1737.description:
A managed service register contains the following for each managed service:
 • managed service provider’s name
 • managed service’s name
 • purpose for using the managed service
 • sensitivity or classification of data involved
 • due date for the next security assessment of the managed service
 • contractual arrangements for the managed service
 • point of contact for users of the managed service
 • 24/7 contact details for the managed service provider.

ISM-1738.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1738.description: The right to verify compliance with security requirements documented in contractual arrangements with service providers is exercised on a regular and ongoing basis.

ISM-1739.name: Approval of security documentation
ISM-1739.description: A system’s security architecture is approved prior to the development of the system.

ISM-1740.name: Managing and reporting suspicious changes to banking details or payment requests
ISM-1740.description: Personnel dealing with banking details and payment requests are advised of what business email compromise is, how to manage such situations and how to report it.

ISM-1741.name: IT equipment destruction processes and procedures
ISM-1741.description: IT equipment destruction processes, and supporting IT equipment destruction procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1742.name: Sanitising IT equipment
ISM-1742.description: IT equipment that cannot be sanitised is destroyed.

ISM-1743.name: Operating system selection
ISM-1743.description: Operating systems are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1745.name: Hardening operating system configurations
ISM-1745.description: Early Launch Antimalware, Secure Boot, Trusted Boot and Measured Boot functionality is enabled.

ISM-1746.name: Application control
ISM-1746.description: When implementing application control using path rules, only approved users can change file system permissions for approved files and folders.

ISM-1748.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1748.description: Email client security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1749.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1749.description: Cached credentials are limited to one previous logon.

ISM-1750.name: Administrative infrastructure
ISM-1750.description: Administrative infrastructure for critical servers, high-value servers and regular servers is segregated from each other.

ISM-1751.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1751.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of IT equipment other than workstations, servers and network devices are applied within one month of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1752.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1752.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in operating systems of IT equipment other than workstations, servers and network devices.

ISM-1753.name: Cessation of support
ISM-1753.description: Network devices and other IT equipment that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.

ISM-1754.name: Reporting and resolving vulnerabilities
ISM-1754.description: Vulnerabilities identified in applications are resolved by software developers in a timely manner.

ISM-1755.name: Vulnerability disclosure program
ISM-1755.description: A vulnerability disclosure policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1756.name: Vulnerability disclosure program
ISM-1756.description: Vulnerability disclosure processes, and supporting vulnerability disclosure procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1759.name: Using Diffie-Hellman
ISM-1759.description: When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus of at least 3072 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.

ISM-1761.name: Using Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman
ISM-1761.description: When using ECDH for agreeing on encryption session keys, NIST P-256, P-384 or P-521 curves are used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.

ISM-1762.name: Using Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman
ISM-1762.description: When using ECDH for agreeing on encryption session keys, NIST P-384 or P-521 curves are used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.

ISM-1763.name: Using the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm
ISM-1763.description: When using ECDSA for digital signatures, NIST P-256, P-384 or P-521 curves are used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.

ISM-1764.name: Using the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm
ISM-1764.description: When using ECDSA for digital signatures, NIST P-384 or P-521 curves are used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.

ISM-1765.name: Using Rivest-Shamir-Adleman
ISM-1765.description: When using RSA for digital signatures, and passing encryption session keys or similar keys, a modulus of at least 3072 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.

ISM-1766.name: Using hashing algorithms
ISM-1766.description: When using SHA-2 for hashing, an output size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably SHA-384.

ISM-1767.name: Using hashing algorithms
ISM-1767.description: When using SHA-2 for hashing, an output size of at least 256 bits is used, preferably SHA-384.

ISM-1768.name: Using hashing algorithms
ISM-1768.description: When using SHA-2 for hashing, an output size of at least 384 bits is used, preferably SHA-384.

ISM-1769.name: Using symmetric encryption algorithms
ISM-1769.description: When using AES for encryption, AES-128, AES-192 or AES-256 is used, preferably AES-256.

ISM-1770.name: Using symmetric encryption algorithms
ISM-1770.description: When using AES for encryption, AES-192 or AES-256 is used, preferably AES-256.

ISM-1771.name: Encryption algorithms
ISM-1771.description: AES is used for encrypting IPsec connections, preferably ENCR_AES_GCM_16.

ISM-1772.name: Pseudorandom function algorithms
ISM-1772.description: PRF_HMAC_SHA2_256, PRF_HMAC_SHA2_384 or PRF_HMAC_SHA2_512 is used for IPsec connections, preferably PRF_HMAC_SHA2_512.

ISM-1773.name: System administrators for gateways
ISM-1773.description: System administrators for gateways that connect to Australian Government Access Only networks are Australian nationals or seconded foreign nationals.

ISM-1774.name: System administration of gateways
ISM-1774.description: Gateways are managed via a secure path isolated from all connected networks.

ISM-1778.name: Manual import of data
ISM-1778.description: When manually importing data to systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

ISM-1779.name: Manual export of data
ISM-1779.description: When manually exporting data from systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

ISM-1780.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-1780.description: SecDevOps practices are used for application development.

ISM-1781.name: Network encryption
ISM-1781.description: All data communicated over network infrastructure is encrypted.

ISM-1782.name: Protective Domain Name System Services
ISM-1782.description: A protective DNS service is used to block access to known malicious domain names.

ISM-1783.name: Border Gateway Protocol route security
ISM-1783.description: Public IP addresses controlled by, or used by, an organisation are signed by valid ROA records.

ISM-1784.name: Cyber security incident management policy
ISM-1784.description: The cyber security incident management policy, including the associated cyber security incident response plan, is exercised at least annually.

ISM-1785.name: Supplier relationship management
ISM-1785.description: A supplier relationship management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1786.name: Supplier relationship management
ISM-1786.description: An approved supplier list is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1787.name: Sourcing applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1787.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are sourced from approved suppliers.

ISM-1788.name: Sourcing applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1788.description: Multiple potential suppliers are identified for sourcing critical applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services.

ISM-1789.name: Sourcing applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1789.description: Sufficient spares of critical IT equipment and OT equipment are sourced and kept in reserve.

ISM-1790.name: Delivery of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1790.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are delivered in a manner that maintains their integrity.

ISM-1791.name: Delivery of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1791.description: The integrity of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.

ISM-1792.name: Delivery of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services
ISM-1792.description: The authenticity of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.

ISM-1793.name: Assessment of managed service providers
ISM-1793.description: Managed service providers and their managed services undergo a security assessment by an IRAP assessor at least every 24 months.

ISM-1794.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1794.description: A minimum notification period of one month by service providers for significant changes to their own service provider arrangements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1795.name: Setting credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts
ISM-1795.description: Credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts are a minimum of 30 characters.

ISM-1796.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-1796.description: Files containing executable content are digitally signed as part of application development.

ISM-1797.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-1797.description: Installers, patches and updates are digitally signed or provided with cryptographic checksums as part of application development.

ISM-1798.name: Secure software design and development
ISM-1798.description: Secure configuration guidance is produced as part of application development.

ISM-1799.name: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance
ISM-1799.description: Incoming emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

ISM-1800.name: Flashing network devices with trusted firmware before first use
ISM-1800.description: Network devices are flashed with trusted firmware before they are used for the first time.

ISM-1801.name: Regularly restarting network devices
ISM-1801.description: Network devices are restarted on at least a monthly basis.

ISM-1802.name: Approved High Assurance Cryptographic Equipment
ISM-1802.description: HACE are issued an Approval for Use by ASD and operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated Australian Communications Security Instructions.

ISM-1803.name: Cyber security incident register
ISM-1803.description:
A cyber security incident register contains the following for each cyber security incident:
 • the date the cyber security incident occurred
 • the date the cyber security incident was discovered
 • a description of the cyber security incident
 • any actions taken in response to the cyber security incident
 • to whom the cyber security incident was reported.

ISM-1804.name: Contractual security requirements with service providers
ISM-1804.description: Break clauses associated with failure to meet security requirements are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1805.name: Denial of service response plan
ISM-1805.description:
A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services contains the following:
 • how to identify signs of a denial-of-service attack
 • how to identify the source of a denial-of-service attack
 • how capabilities can be maintained during a denial-of-service attack
 • what actions can be taken to respond to a denial-of-service attack.

ISM-1806.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1806.description: Default accounts or credentials for user applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1807.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1807.description: An automated method of asset discovery is used at least fortnightly to support the detection of assets for subsequent vulnerability scanning activities.

ISM-1808.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1808.description: A vulnerability scanner with an up-to-date vulnerability database is used for vulnerability scanning activities.

ISM-1809.name: Cessation of support
ISM-1809.description: When applications, operating systems, network devices or other IT equipment that are no longer supported by vendors cannot be immediately removed or replaced, compensating controls are implemented until such time that they can be removed or replaced.

ISM-1810.name: Performing and retaining backups
ISM-1810.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are synchronised to enable restoration to a common point in time.

ISM-1811.name: Performing and retaining backups
ISM-1811.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are retained in a secure and resilient manner.

ISM-1812.name: Backup access
ISM-1812.description: Unprivileged accounts cannot access backups belonging to other accounts.

ISM-1813.name: Backup access
ISM-1813.description: Unprivileged accounts cannot access their own backups.

ISM-1814.name: Backup modification and deletion
ISM-1814.description: Unprivileged accounts are prevented from modifying and deleting backups.

ISM-1815.name: Centralised event logging facility
ISM-1815.description: Event logs are protected from unauthorised modification and deletion.

ISM-1816.name: Development, testing and production environments
ISM-1816.description: Unauthorised modification of the authoritative source for software is prevented.

ISM-1817.name: Web application programming interfaces
ISM-1817.description: Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate access to data not authorised for release into the public domain.

ISM-1818.name: Web application programming interfaces
ISM-1818.description: Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate modification of data.

ISM-1819.name: Enacting cyber security incident response plans
ISM-1819.description: Following the identification of a cyber security incident, the cyber security incident response plan is enacted.

ISM-1820.name: Cable colours
ISM-1820.description: Cables for individual systems use a consistent colour.

ISM-1821.name: Common cable bundles and conduits
ISM-1821.description: TOP SECRET cables, when bundled together or run in conduit, are run exclusively in their own individual cable bundle or conduit.

ISM-1822.name: Wall outlet box colours
ISM-1822.description: Wall outlet boxes for individual systems use a consistent colour.

ISM-1823.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1823.description: Office productivity suite security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1824.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1824.description: PDF software security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1825.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1825.description: Security product security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1826.name: Server application selection
ISM-1826.description: Server applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1827.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers
ISM-1827.description: Microsoft AD DS domain controllers are administered using dedicated domain administrator user accounts that are not used to administer other systems.

ISM-1828.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers
ISM-1828.description: The Print Spooler service is disabled on Microsoft AD DS domain controllers.

ISM-1829.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers
ISM-1829.description: Passwords and cpasswords are not used in Group Policy Preferences.

ISM-1830.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers
ISM-1830.description: Security-related events for Microsoft AD DS are centrally logged.

ISM-1832.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1832.description: Only service accounts and computer accounts are configured with Service Principal Names (SPNs).

ISM-1833.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1833.description: Service accounts are provisioned with the minimum privileges required and are not members of the domain administrators group or similar highly privileged groups.

ISM-1834.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1834.description: Duplicate SPNs do not exist within the domain.

ISM-1835.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1835.description: Privileged user accounts are configured as sensitive and cannot be delegated.

ISM-1836.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening

ISM-1837.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1837.description: User accounts are not configured with password never expires or password not required.

ISM-1838.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1838.description: The UserPassword attribute for user accounts is not used.

ISM-1839.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1839.description: Account properties accessible by unprivileged users are not used to store passwords.

ISM-1840.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1840.description: User account passwords do not use reversible encryption.

ISM-1841.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1841.description: Unprivileged user accounts cannot add machines to the domain.

ISM-1842.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1842.description: Dedicated service accounts are used to add machines to the domain.

ISM-1843.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1843.description: User accounts with unconstrained delegation are reviewed at least annually, and those without an associated Kerberos SPN or demonstrated business requirement are removed.

ISM-1844.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services account hardening
ISM-1844.description: Computer accounts that are not Microsoft AD DS domain controllers are not trusted for delegation to services.

ISM-1845.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services security group memberships
ISM-1845.description: When a user account is disabled, it is removed from all security group memberships.

ISM-1846.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services security group memberships
ISM-1846.description: The Pre-Windows 2000 Compatible Access security group does not contain user accounts.

ISM-1847.name: Changing credentials
ISM-1847.description:
Credentials for the Kerberos Key Distribution Center’s service account (KRBTGT) are changed twice, allowing for replication to all Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers in-between each change, if:
 • the domain has been directly compromised
 • the domain is suspected of being compromised
 • they have not been changed in the past 12 months.

ISM-1848.name: Functional separation between computing environments
ISM-1848.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism or underlying operating system is replaced when it is no longer supported by a vendor.

ISM-1849.name: Secure web application design and development
ISM-1849.description: The OWASP Top 10 Proactive Controls are used in the development of web applications.

ISM-1850.name: Secure web application design and development
ISM-1850.description: The OWASP Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web applications.

ISM-1851.name: Web application programming interfaces
ISM-1851.description: The OWASP API Security Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web APIs.

ISM-1852.name: Unprivileged access to systems
ISM-1852.description: Unprivileged access to systems, applications and data repositories is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1854.name: Authenticating to multifunction devices
ISM-1854.description: Users authenticate to MFDs before they can print, scan or copy documents.

ISM-1855.name: Logging multifunction device use
ISM-1855.description: Use of MFDs for printing, scanning and copying purposes, including the capture of shadow copies of documents, are centrally logged.

ISM-1857.name: IT equipment selection
ISM-1857.description: IT equipment is chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1858.name: Hardening IT equipment configurations
ISM-1858.description: IT equipment is hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1859.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1859.description: Office productivity suites are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1860.name: Hardening user application configurations
ISM-1860.description: PDF software is hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1861.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1861.description: Local Security Authority protection functionality is enabled.

ISM-1862.name: Web application firewalls
ISM-1862.description: If using a WAF, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the WAF and authorised management networks.

ISM-1863.name: Networked management interfaces
ISM-1863.description: Networked management interfaces for IT equipment are not directly exposed to the internet.

ISM-1864.name: System usage policy
ISM-1864.description: A system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1865.name: System access requirements
ISM-1865.description: Personnel agree to abide by usage policies associated with a system and its resources before being granted access to the system and its resources.

ISM-1866.name: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers
ISM-1866.description: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers are prevented from storing classified data on their privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers.

ISM-1867.name: Approved mobile platforms
ISM-1867.description: Mobile devices that access OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data use mobile platforms that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Fundamentals, version 3.3 or later, and are operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated ASD security configuration guide.

ISM-1868.name: Data storage
ISM-1868.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices do not use removable media unless approved beforehand by ASD.

ISM-1869.name: IT equipment registers
ISM-1869.description: A non-networked IT equipment register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1870.name: Application control
ISM-1870.description: Application control is applied to user profiles and temporary folders used by operating systems, web browsers and email clients.

ISM-1871.name: Application control
ISM-1871.description: Application control is applied to all locations other than user profiles and temporary folders used by operating systems, web browsers and email clients.

ISM-1872.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1872.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating users of online services is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1873.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1873.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating customers of online customer services provides a phishing-resistant option.

ISM-1874.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1874.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating customers of online customer services is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1875.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1875.description: Networks are scanned at least monthly to identify any credentials that are being stored in the clear.

ISM-1876.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1876.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in online services are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1877.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1877.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing servers and internet-facing network devices are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1878.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1878.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of IT equipment other than workstations, servers and network devices are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1879.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1879.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in drivers are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1880.name: Reporting cyber security incidents to customers and the public
ISM-1880.description: Cyber security incidents that involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

ISM-1881.name: Reporting cyber security incidents to customers and the public
ISM-1881.description: Cyber security incidents that do not involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

ISM-1882.name: Cyber supply chain risk management activities
ISM-1882.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to transparency for their products and services.

ISM-1883.name: Privileged access to systems
ISM-1883.description: Privileged accounts explicitly authorised to access online services are strictly limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1884.name: Emanation security doctrine
ISM-1884.description: Emanation security doctrine produced by ASD for the management of emanation security matters is complied with.

ISM-1885.name: Emanation security threat assessments
ISM-1885.description: Recommended actions contained within TEMPEST requirements statements issued for systems are implemented by system owners.

ISM-1886.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-1886.description: Mobile devices are configured to operate in a supervised (or equivalent) mode.

ISM-1887.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-1887.description: Mobile devices are configured with remote locate and wipe functionality.

ISM-1888.name: Maintaining mobile device security
ISM-1888.description: Mobile devices are configured with secure lock screens.

ISM-1889.name: Command Shell
ISM-1889.description: Command line process creation events are centrally logged.

ISM-1890.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1890.description: Microsoft Office macros are checked to ensure they are free of malicious code before being digitally signed or placed within Trusted Locations.

ISM-1891.name: Microsoft Office macros
ISM-1891.description: Microsoft Office macros digitally signed by signatures other than V3 signatures cannot be enabled via the Message Bar or Backstage View.

ISM-1892.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1892.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to their organisation’s online customer services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive customer data.

ISM-1893.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1893.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to third-party online customer services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive customer data.

ISM-1894.name: Multi-factor authentication
ISM-1894.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating users of data repositories is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1895.name: Single-factor authentication
ISM-1895.description: Successful and unsuccessful single-factor authentication events are centrally logged.

ISM-1897.name: Protecting credentials
ISM-1897.description: Remote Credential Guard functionality is enabled.

ISM-1898.name: Separate privileged operating environments
ISM-1898.description: Secure Admin Workstations are used in the performance of administrative activities.

ISM-1899.name: Administrative infrastructure
ISM-1899.description: Network devices that do not belong to administrative infrastructure cannot initiate connections with administrative infrastructure.

ISM-1900.name: Scanning for unmitigated vulnerabilities
ISM-1900.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in firmware.

ISM-1901.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
ISM-1901.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within two weeks of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1902.name: Mitigating known vulnerabilities
